text: written. - Mr Tusk should have recognized in this debate the evident failure of the Union governments in managing the migration crisis. Failure that he has forced to reach an agreement questioned by a large part of the humanitarian organizations and that in its first days of application has already demonstrated its ineffectiveness. The Agreement with Turkey de facto implies a waiver of our legal, political and ethical obligations. In recent months we have been building, by closing borders, an inhumane mousetrap for refugees, and now we are trying to close the last door. Public opinion speaks of the shame of Europe and national leaders rub their hands, because to speak of the shame of Europe is to hide their own ineffectiveness and inability to fulfill the commitments and obligations they had to carry out, applying the principle of solidarity. This incompetence is unacceptable because we are talking about the lives of hundreds of thousands of people, many of them minors, fleeing war and death. The Europe project is in jeopardy. Let's not write the last page of our history with the suffering of these people.

name: Ana GOMES
text: in writing. – The EU-Turkey deal to outsource the refugee problem is a disgrace: the EU is violating human rights and international law by detaining asylum seekers and forcibly deporting them, without even the possibility to ask for asylum, via a Kafkaesque Skype system, which is not operational. Also the agreement is not even working: it is not stopping people from coming over from Turkey, Libya or Russia and certainly is not stopping the trafficking mafias: actually it is giving them more opportunities for their sordid business. Idomeni will remain an ugly scar in our faces as Europeans. Opening safe and legal routes and channels for asylum seekers and migrants’ applications, as Canada has done, should have been the alternative – but the Council refused to even consider that. Presidents Tusk and Juncker – you failed to act last summer against your EPP pal Viktor Orbán when he defiantly refused to participate in the relocation distribution scheme agreed by the Council. No wonder now you are failing again to sanction the Visegrad Member States, led by Austria and commanded by Germany, who have bombed Schengen by closing borders with Greece and who are about to raise fences with Italy. By failing to act, you are sinking Europe!

name: Enrique GUERRERO SALOM
text: written. - Mr Tusk should have recognized in this debate the evident failure of the Union governments in managing the migration crisis. Failure that he has forced to reach an agreement questioned by a large part of the humanitarian organizations and that in its first days of implementation has already demonstrated its ineffectiveness. The Agreement with Turkey de facto implies a waiver of our legal, political and ethical obligations. In recent months we have been building, by closing borders, an inhumane mousetrap for refugees, and now we are trying to close the last door. Public opinion speaks of the shame of Europe and national leaders rub their hands, because to speak of the shame of Europe is to hide their own ineffectiveness and inability to fulfill the commitments and obligations that they had to carry out, applying the principle of solidarity. This incompetence is unacceptable because we are talking about the lives of hundreds of thousands of people, many of them minors, fleeing war and death. The Europe project is in jeopardy. Let's not write the last page of our history with the suffering of these people.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: written. - The refugee agreement with Turkey and the closure of the Balkan route have resulted in 80 percent fewer migrants coming to Greece via the Aegean. This is proven by the figures from the border protection agency Frontex. From the beginning of 2016 until the EU summit on March 18, 1,676 refugees landed in Greece every day; since the agreement with Turkey came into force, the figure is only 337 per day. This leads to relief in Greece, but at the same time to a new burden for Italy. Indeed, migration flows have shifted from Greece to Italy, where record numbers are being recorded over the same period. Among the migrants who choose the central Mediterranean route are few Syrians, but primarily people from Nigeria, Somalia, Gambia, Guinea and the Ivory Coast. In Libya alone, a million people are waiting to cross to Europe. EU Council President Donald Tusk today described the figures in Libya as worrying and spoke out in favor of a European coast guard. The establishment of a European coast guard with the right to stop and control migrants would indeed be an important measure to reduce migration flows. However, it would be much more important and also more sustainable to use the funds from development cooperation in a targeted manner to eliminate reasons for fleeing and to reintegrate migrants in their countries of origin.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- Two crises - refugees and agriculture were discussed in the Council.I think they both have some connections.First of all, it is necessary to talk about the living conditions of refugees in temporary camps, which are often inhumane.On the other hand, we have a surplus of dairy products.Europe has been buying butter, milk powder in intervention for some time now and I think they could reach the camps.In this way, everyone would win - firstly, we will ensure that the people in the camps have dairy products, and secondly, the problem of surpluses will be addressed.I would like to welcome the European Commission's decision to supply milk to Syrian children, but I do not support the allocation of 30 million from the Farmers' Support Fund for this program.This would not be possible with the supply of dairy products to refugees.

name: Alfred SANT
text: in writing. – It was necessary to conclude quickly an agreement between the EU and Turkey on migrant flows. In prevailing circumstances the agreement is the best arrangement possible. However, the strategic flaws inherent in it should be recognised. The most important problem remains that Turkey-EU relations have become poisoned by a mutual bad faith that is long-term in scope. It goes beyond the ongoing differences that relate to Europe’s critical views about authoritarian developments and human rights issues in Turkey’s governance; the Kurdish question; and the problem of a divided Cyprus. Even if all these issues were resolved, the bad faith would persist. There is still a lack of clarity and honesty regarding Turkey’s future as a member or non-member of the European Union. Is the EU able, with one voice, to declare unequivocally that should Turkey satisfy all the requirements for it to become an EU member, membership would inevitably ensue? The answer is no. But this is not acknowledged. So an indispensable basis, one way or another, by which to define EU-Turkey relations long-term is missing. It is another reason why the EU’s diplomatic leverage with Turkey is so restricted and both sides regard each other with suspicion.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: in writing.- In the framework of the agreement with Turkey, on the one hand, I welcome a solution to the refugee situation, but on the other hand, I do not consider it to be Turkey's automatic ticket to the EU.Cooperation on migration should not be linked to accession negotiations, for which clear and strict criteria apply.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: in writing. - I appreciate that, on the basis of the Commission's concrete proposals, the recent decisions of the European Council and the agreement with the Turkish Government, together with all its many political echoes, are finally bringing a real European solution to the refugee crisis. It must be emphasized, however, that this is only an initial effort and that a complex solution must include strengthening the Schengen system, completely overhauling the Dublin system and introducing effective redirection and resettlement practices for all Member States. At the same time, I would like to draw the attention of the representatives of the Commission and the Council to the fact that millions of European citizens will not be affected by the important decisions of 17-18 March, precisely because of the deceptive policies of their own governments and leaders. Mostly in Hungary, where there is government propaganda and anti-alienation specifically against the decisions of the European Council, while the Orbán regime is organizing a self-justifying referendum against non-existent European decisions. Such an irresponsible policy can be seen as marginal and temporary, but it can in fact distort the views of the population of these Member States on refugees for decades, the image of Europe, while jeopardizing the urgent renewal of European migration policy. I believe that not only the authority of the European Council, but the meaning of the whole European decision-making system will be called into question if this anomaly cannot be addressed by the responsible leaders of the European institutions and the other Member States.

name: Tomáš ZDECHOVSKÝ
text: in writing.- I have rather mixed feelings about the results of this Council.The agreement that could be reached could help the EU reduce the number of illegal immigrants, but at what cost ?.It is clear that the EU must work with Turkey.However, Turkey must prove that it is a partner for the EU in resolving the migration crisis.A partner we can rely on at such critical moments.If Turkey is unable to do so and comes up with meaningless conditions, it cannot count on financial assistance from the EU or on the EU-28 nodding at its demands, led by visa liberalization or the revival of accession negotiations.

name: Martin SCHULZ
text: Dear Colleagues! We are now signing the Interinstitutional Agreement between Parliament, the Council and the Commission on better law-making. I would like to take this opportunity to thank the other two institutions. First of all, I would like to thank Minister Hennis-Plasschaert warmly for being ready to sign this with us today. However, I hope you are not angry at this point, and I would like to take this opportunity to express my heartfelt thanks to the Luxembourg Presidency, including Minister Nicolas Schmit, who has put extraordinary effort into the matter. The same thank you, President Juncker, goes to your Commission and Vice-President Frans Timmermans, who invested a great deal of time and effort in these negotiations. But I would like to thank a colleague in this House from the bottom of my heart who has made this agreement a matter of the heart and - I think - for the European Parliament with this agreement he has worked out a milestone in our interinstitutional relations, that is Mr Guy Verhofstadt, the I would like to take this opportunity to thank you very much for his work. May I also ask him to take part in the signing, and I would be grateful now, Mr Juncker and Ms. Hennis-Plasschaert, if we could sign this below. (Applause) (The sitting was briefly suspended for the signature of the interinstitutional agreement.)

name: Martin SCHULZ
text: Dear colleagues! Thank you for your warm welcome to our guest of honor today, the President of Portugal. I would like to say not just a warm welcome to you, Mr President, to the European Parliament, but a warm welcome with a special touch. Ladies and gentlemen! As usual, I telephoned him to congratulate him immediately after the election and the inauguration of Mr Rebelo de Sousa. During that telephone conversation the Portuguese President said to me: I would like to make my first state visit outside Portugal to the European Parliament. (Applause) This is not just a symbolic gesture by a head of state, ladies and gentlemen. During our conversation, Mr President, we spoke very intensively about the state of the European Union, about the role of your country within the European Union. I want to quote what you said there: “My visit here is an expression of my deep pro-European conviction, and I want the European Parliament to know: Portugal has a President whose main task is to deepen European cooperation in the international arena I want to participate in politics. ”For this, Mr. President, we are sincerely grateful. It's your turn. Here you go!

name: Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa
text: President of the Portuguese Republic. - Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, Merci infiniment, Monsieur le Président, pour l'honneur that you are making me a part of the maison de la démocratie. de la République portugaise. Ich danke Ihnen, Herr Präsident Martin Schulz, dafür, dass ich die legitimen Vertreter der europäischen Bevölkerung ansprechen darf, die ich jetzt bestätigen möchte. House of Democracy because no other European institution on this scale underlies the principles of freedom of security, humanism, citizen participation, which this Assembly - and each of its members - represents and guarantees. Being able to be here today is a sign of the relevance that European integration assumed in the birth and affirmation of Portuguese democracy. But it is also a sign of personal commitment, born out of a very old design. I belong to a generation of Portuguese for whom Europe and integration in it were a dream, inseparable from democracy, decolonization, economic development and Social Justice. The conversion of the dictatorship into democracy passed through the end of the Empire, but not less by the affirmation of Portugal's belonging to Europe, its geographical, historical and cultural cradle. And, more clearly from the 60s of the last century, the destination of its main emigration and origin and destination of its trade. We believed in Europe in itself, for what it represented as an example of peace, solidarity, growth, social equity, cultural experience. But we still saw it as an incentive to build a new Portugal. For this reason, I remember with longing the first university delegation to the Communities, which I integrated, in the most complex period of the Revolution; or the European influence in my activity, in my early twenties, as a constituent deputy, between 1975 and 1976. And for that reason, I was thrilled with the application for membership in 1977, with the long negotiations until 1985, with the laborious construction of the single currency, which, as leader of the opposition, led me to make three state budgets feasible for a minority government, thus contributing to Portugal's entry into the euro zone. And allow me to confess to you the joy and pride I felt with the election of a Portuguese - José Manuel Durão Barroso - for the presidency of the European Commission; and tell them of the particular commitment and pride that I feel with the activity of Portuguese deputies - of strictly all Portuguese deputies - in this Assembly. Old, strong beliefs never change. I remain convinced of the irreplaceable role of the European Union, in Europe and in the world. And, since there is democracy, Portugal remains faithful to this constant of its national strategy, with all its presidents and with all their governments. (Applause) This year Portugal celebrates 40 years of the Constitution, the founding charter of freedom and democracy. For the consolidation of Portuguese democracy, the European Communities played an essential role. The European Union's contribution to the development of my country and to the improvement of the quality of life of its people was - and continues to be - essential. Portugal was able to successfully take advantage of structural funds from Europe, modernized the productive fabric, qualified the labor force, built essential infrastructures. But, in order to adjust to European rules, Portugal was forced to take in 12 years the steps that strongest economies had taken in more than 40 and, in the middle, decolonized in two years and welcomed and integrated, in a population of nine million , 700,000 Portuguese-speaking Africans and nationals, saw military power remain until 1982, moved from a partially colonial, rural and closed economy to a European economy, globalized, open, progressively re-privatized, with more services and new industries. The price of these changes in a short period of time was immense and neither the use of funds demonstrations of understanding and European support for Portugal, was sufficient for the necessary consolidation. The global and European crises of 2008 and 2009 joined the structural problems still to be solved and, for three and a half years, an Adjustment Program, in which the European Commission, the European Central Bank and the International Monetary Fund intervened, tested the historical capacity of the Portuguese to withstand crises and personal sacrifices so that the internal and external financial balances could succeed. As President of the Portuguese Republic, I am proud to be here today before this Assembly and to be able to say: Europe did not fail to help Portugal and Portugal honored its commitments, leaving the Adjustment Program cleanly. (Applause) Today, Portugal wants to continue to guarantee financial equilibrium, control of the deficit, control of public debt and, at the same time, begin to compensate for the most sacrificed social sectors in the recent past, believing that, in addition to private investment and exports, household consumption can also help to create growth and jobs. It is a path that aims at the same macroeconomic and financial goals, but which is, in part, different from the previous one, led by a government that is also European, respectful of internationally assumed commitments, supported in Parliament not only by one of the two main European political families, but also by parties of another relevant European family, which, until now, had been outside the area of ​​constitutional executive power in Portugal. Although with roots that come from a doctrinal area different from those in which the current parliamentary majority is inserted, as President of all Portuguese, which I am, I feel that it is essential to pacify, to de-dramatize, to heal wounds, to rebuild consensus. My message is therefore clear, ladies and gentlemen: stability, refusal of political crises to add to economic and social issues, search for broad convergences, strengthening the financial system - that a recent step may be a good sign - , capacity to carry out administrative, judicial, human qualification, capitalization of companies and social cohesion reforms and the sincere desire that the demanding path of reconciliation between financial rigor and social concerns, based on growth also due to the dynamism of the market, is fully successful internal. Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I am an incorrigible Europeanist. The Europe I dreamed and dreamed of, and the overwhelming majority of Portuguese dreams, faces new challenges, much more complicated than those they have faced in the past. They are the ones who tell us that it is not time to falter or to limp. Reflection on the future of the Union must give new life to a model that has allowed Europe to go through a period of peace and prosperity, previously unknown in its millenary history. We must continue, bypassing xenophobic behaviors, combating exacerbated nationalisms, rejecting sterile chauvinisms, refusing isolations from the past. It is by itself, already, an immense and enviable legacy that needs to be expanded and prolonged. The debate on the European Union, bearing in mind the new challenges, will only be fruitful, however, if it is based on a constant dialogue with the citizens of Europe, respecting their legitimate aspirations to live in an area of ​​security, freedom and justice, growth, employment, being and solidarity. And it is therefore also essential that European and national leaders are attentive to these aspirations, looking at the will manifested in terms proper to our democratic societies, which requires greater European pedagogy and greater proximity to citizens. The Europe I dream of wants to remain united and supportive, internally and externally, attentive to possible arrivals, wishing there are no departures. Always looking for joint solutions to the social effects of wars in neighboring areas, namely in the case of refugees, in which case Portugal has been an example. In proportion to its population, being, perhaps, the main European country or countries to show readiness to welcome and include refugees within Portuguese society. This situation requires that the fundamental issues are not forgotten, under the urgency of mere short-term agreements, which we all wish not to be questionable or insufficient. The Europe with which I dream, which has so often triumphed over barbarism and totalitarianism, will also be able to overcome the threats of religious and political fanaticism and terrorism. To this end, acting in solidarity in the face of difficult contexts and dramatic effects, translated into attacks that under no circumstances can fail to be unconditionally condemned. And here, again, my solidarity with France and Belgium is expressed. The Europe with which it aspires to have a global political weight corresponding to its commercial weight, for which it is important that its voice is increasingly heard and that it continues to effectively lead universal causes, such as, among others, that of financial transparency, which agree with the discrediting of democratic systems, institutions and protagonists and that of intergenerational environmental justice. The Europe I dream of wants to see politics and law keeping pace with scientific, technical, economic, social and cultural reality. A Europe that recovers the peoples, the electorates, the youngest, those forgotten at the end of their professional careers, for a cause that combats pessimism and militant skepticism. The Europe I dream of has in Portugal and for that Union it was an immense legion of dreamers sharing the same dream: a Europe with a project that brings freedom, justice, democracy, solidarity, transparency and popular roots. The Europe I dream of has Portugal at the forefront of this fight and is - and must be - optimistic. Otherwise, it is no longer Europe. Otherwise, it is no longer a symbol of the future. The Europe that I dream of keeps in its memory what Portugal in the strength of its simplicity brought to and from other continents, cultures and civilizations, and that enriches us so much. The Portugal that I have brought with me today crossed seas and faraway lands but never forgot that it belongs to the lands of Homer, Shakespeare, Goethe, Proust, Cervantes, Dante, Joyce, Strindberg, Kundera, Kafka, Szymborska and Pessoa, and many , many others. We are Europeans; we will always be Europeans. Thank you very much. (Applause)

name: Martin SCHULZ
text: Thank you very much, Mr President!I don't think I need to say anything more.Thank you, dear colleagues.We wish you all the best in voting.Mr President, you are welcome here at any time.Let me add one thing: that was a speech that has encouraged all those in this House who think the same way as you do.You have seen that the vast majority are.Many Thanks!

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: -  Dear!On 17 December last year, this Parliament adopted a resolution on the annual report on human rights and democracy and the European Union's policy in this area.In Chapter 78 of the resolution, we demanded respect for the fundamental rights of the Sahrawi people and the release of political prisoners from Moroccan prisons.These days, we have watched with concern the hunger strike of young people who have been unjustly sentenced to years in prison by a Moroccan military court in connection with the events in Lajun.I call on the President of this House and the Commission, in their contacts with the Moroccan authorities, to take into account this Parliament's demand for the release of political prisoners and for respect for human rights.

name: David Maria SASSOLI
text: Thank you Mrs Vajgl.

name: David Maria SASSOLI
text: On March 10, the President imposed a sanction on Hon.Bay for voting with the Hon.Le Pen.On Monday 11 April, the Bureau dealt with the appeal presented by the Hon.Bay and unanimously confirmed President Schulz's decision to impose on the Hon.Bay the penalty consisting in the loss of his subsistence allowance for a period of five days.

name: David Maria SASSOLI
text: The next item is voting time.(For the results of the votes and other details concerning them: see Minutes)

name: Angélique DELAHAYE
text: - Mr President, for the sake of compromise, ladies and gentlemen, in order to try to reconcile opinions and minimize differences, I would like to propose the following amendment to Amendment 11, first part: "asks the Commission to renewapproval of glyphosate for a maximum period of seven years; recalls that Regulation (EC) No 11 07 2009 allows the Commission to withdraw the approval of an active substance during the period during which it was authorized if itno longer meets the approval criteria ".

name: Syed KAMALL
text: – Mr President, on behalf of the ECR Group, I rise to propose an adjournment of the vote on the resolution on the situation in Poland under Rules 185 and 192. Commissioner Timmermans travelled to Poland last week for dialogue with the Polish Government. By all accounts, this was very constructive and Mr Timmermans is  returning again in a few days’ time for more dialogue. I propose that we postpone this vote until after those meetings have taken place. Surely this House would rather see an amicable solution found to the situation that involves dialogue rather than petty and cheap mudslinging. If this resolution is genuinely an attempt by this Chamber to assist in the resolution of this matter in an amicable way, then it is in all our interests to move forward in talks between the Polish Government and the Commission. If this is not a politically driven resolution, then I believe this House can agree to this simply modest request.  (Applause)

name: Jadwiga WIŚNIEWSKA
text: - Mr Chairman!On January 15, we asked the European Commission about the legal grounds for the Commission's interference in Poland's internal affairs.We asked for an indication of the treaty grounds for this interference.Three months have passed and we have not received a reply, although the deadline is six weeks.The Commission is unable to indicate the treaty grounds for this interference, because there are no such grounds.Interference in the internal affairs of the Member States is contrary to the EU's treaty principles.I appeal for the vote to be postponed until the legal basis is indicated.There is a statement: "Doctor, heal yourself."You want to fix the law in Poland, and you break European law yourself.By harming Poland, you are harming Europe.

name: Gianni PITTELLA
text: - (IT) Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I would humbly remind the whole House that a country is free to join the European Union, no one can force it, its citizens choose it, but when it joins the European Union it is obliged toto respect the rules and decisions of the European Union.Therefore, no interference, but a legitimate and dutiful interest on the part of a European institution in what happens within one's family, because Poland is part of our family and we are interested in the fate of Polish citizens.This resolution is nothing more than the follow-up to the result of the Venice Convention, which spoke clearly and we ask that it be respected by the Polish authorities.

name: Lars ADAKTUSSON
text: written.- The EU Globalization Adjustment Fund is intended to provide assistance to people who have become unemployed following the closure of European companies.The Christian Democrats are opposed to this fund for two reasons.Firstly, labor market policy and financial support for the unemployed must be decided on, and financed, at national level - not at EU level.Secondly, the basic idea of the fund is based on the fact that globalization is something negative - which is not true.I therefore vote consistently against the payments from the fund.I feel sympathy for the Volvo workers who have lost their jobs, but it is Sweden that should take responsibility for supporting them in the transition phase to a new job - not the EU.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to balance the markets in the face of imbalances due to an increase in international trade.The Negrescu report concerns Volvo Group Truck in Sweden, and aims at the reintegration of 500 workers affected by the crisis in the truck industry.In the absence of viable alternatives, we believe that the EGF can support the local Swedish economy.For this reason, I voted in favor.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report as it allows the mobilization of an amount of 1,793,710 euros following the dismissal of 500 workers from the Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA company in Sweden as a result of the reductions at the Umeå plant, and others177 from four suppliers and processors of products of this company (IL Logistics AB, Lemia, Caverion and Isringhausen).This mobilization of funds aims to mitigate the disastrous social consequences of the economic crisis of the capitalist system.Although these funds are not capable of solving the problems of these workers in Sweden, they at least give the possibility of alleviating a small part of the human drama.It is for all this that I have decided to vote in favor of this report

name: Louis ALIOT
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this text on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.The objective of this report is to mobilize the sum of 1.793 million euros with the aim of reintegrating into the labor market 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operation".Even if this text tries to hide the fact that this type of disaster is only the consequence of the free trade trade policies of the Union, I position myself as a defender of these workers.As the latter are the first victims of the proliferation of free trade agreements, I firmly support the granting of this aid.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. – I voted in favour of this report which was concerned with an application to the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund. The report concerned the Volvo Group Truck Operation and 647 workers were being made redundant workers. The European Globalisation Fund provides financial support to groups of workers who have lost their jobs due to the impacts of globalisation and recession. The European Commission provides a portion of the fund which is then matched by the relevant government. However the fund has been subject to significant controversies in the past. Money has been used to fund existing supports for redundant workers rather than additional supports. Workers were not adequately involved in the roll out of the programmes. Worst of all, tens of millions of euros have been returned to the European Commission unspent due to failure of Government to properly run the programmes. On a number of occasions more than 40% of the EU funding for specific programmes has been returned unspent. This is absolutely unacceptable and highlights the Irish Government’s lack of action or care on such vital funding issues. This apathetic and incompetent attitude is unacceptable and is something that I will continue to raise on an EU level.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing.- If the EGF is a stopgap aiming timidly to disguise the consequences of the Union's trade policies, and removes the responsibility of large companies, this aid seems useful for the reintegration of workers who do not have to submit to the free trade whims ofthe European Commission.I therefore voted for this report.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ The principle of subsidiarity dictates that decisions should be taken at the closest possible level to the citizen – in this case, at regional or national level. Therefore, these projects should not be funded by the European Union. It is absurd that the arbiters of whether this funding should, or should not, be given are Members of the European Parliament with no detailed knowledge of the situation. This project may well be of benefit to the people of Sweden, but I am not best placed to judge. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund should be scrapped, which would give money back to the Member States to decide for themselves about the appropriateness of such funding. Consequently, I had no option but to vote against – even though this may be a worthwhile project.

name: Jean ARTHUIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this deliberation, which provides for assistance of € 1,793,710 for the mobilization of the Globalization Adjustment Fund, in order to help redundant Volvo Trucks employees find a job.Help from this fund is welcome to revitalize and support this line of business.Nevertheless, I regret that the payment of this aid is made in the light of layoffs when it could have been invaluable in helping the company to restructure.It is urgent to act and understand that our companies are the victims of the absence of the structural reforms necessary for their adaptation to the challenges of globalization.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this proposal, which aims to mobilize the EGF to help Sweden support the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant in 5 trailer companies. The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. A total of EUR 1 793 710 is requested from the EGF for Sweden for 500 redundant workers. The redundancies have taken place in recent years due to changes affecting the European commercial vehicle sector, in particular the truck industry, in particular the emergence of new Asian truck manufacturers, as well as difficulties in the truck industry adapting to efficiency and cost reductions. The service package will include a range of job search activities and counseling, motivation and health measures, and education and training.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against giving EUR 1 793 710 to Swedish workers who had been made redundant. The unelected and unaccountable EU has no right to spend British taxpayers’ money in this way.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- I can only support this report which recommends granting, with the help of the EGF, an aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations"in Sweden.However, I deplore the irony of a report which presents competition from Asian manufacturers as the cause of these layoffs, when the EU continues, in the name of free trade, to open the European market to Asian productions.This is why the EGF, however beneficial it may be for those Swedish workers who do not have to submit to the Commission's free-trade whims, will only be a stopgap as long as the essential trade policy issueEU will not be settled.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- As always, I voted in favor of this mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) which will help the 470 workers made redundant at Volvo Trucks in Sweden and the 177 other workers from suppliers or producers indownstream.China dominates the automotive sector and certain factors (demographic change, increasing urbanization, etc.) lead to the anticipation of increased competition in the future.The mobilization of this fund is important because it makes it possible to regulate the devastating effects that globalization can cause on employees.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, in favor of Sweden, following the redundancy of 647 workers in the Volvo Truck Operations group, EMEA, and four other suppliers and downstream producers in the region of Northern Norrland. The rise of the truck industry in Asia, in particular China and India, has led to a profound change in the global market, forcing European manufacturers to intervene on costs to improve competitiveness at international level. However, the measures taken by the five Swedish companies have led to the redundancy of some workers who must be supported with the appropriate social protection measures. The mobilization of the EGF represents an important opportunity to support workers in their search for new employment and helps to strengthen the social dimension of Europe, for these reasons I supported the Negrescu report.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written. - We have voted in favor of this report, as it promotes funds intended to compensate and establish compensation measures in cases of relocation or company closures due to structural changes in the markets due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of laid-off workers, and help young people without studies or employment, this time for those affected by the reductions of the Volvo Group and its suppliers in Umeå, Sweden. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide the fact that these types of measures are "bread for today and hunger for tomorrow", while the issue of employment and relocations should have another focus of action. On the one hand, Europe needs an investment plan, different from the one it is carrying out so far, and another employment policy, to act on labor matters. Secondly, this alternative should consist of investing in future activities, especially in changing the production model, and seeking sustainability outlets for these areas.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I have supported this report on the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Volvo Sweden which would support the re-entry into the labor market of laid off workers in five companies operating in the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers.This fund would benefit 500 laid-off workers.As I have done on other occasions regarding the Fund, I have voted in favor of it.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the allocation of aid - via the European Globalization Adjustment Fund - of 1.793 million euros in favor of Volvo employees.They are in turn the victim of the savage competition of our automobile industries with the Chinese market, which, as we know, has a workforce at lower cost.This allows the Chinese giant to carve out the lion's share in the automotive sector with 34% of the market share.The Union, which has opened its market to all winds without applying a necessary economic patriotism as do its main competitors - Chinese, American - has a good game to then feel sorry for the precariousness of employees and grant them this meager compensation, which is only a bandage on open wounds.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- I supported, with my vote, the mobilization of the EGF for an amount of almost EUR 1.8 million in favor of 500 Swedish workers and 5 companies operating in the automotive, trailer and semi-trailer manufacturing sector.The Globalization Adjustment Fund is a very important tool to support citizens in this time of crisis, but the EU should focus on resolving the malfunctions of the internal market as a whole, rather than just looking after its victims.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written. - I voted in favor of this report to approve the mobilization of € 1,793,710 from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for 500 workers who have lost their jobs at Volvo Trucks and four suppliers and product processors in Sweden, as a result of the major structural changes in world trade patterns brought about by globalization. Commercial vehicle manufacturing is no longer dominated by European and North American manufacturers as new truck manufacturers are emerging in Asia while heavy truck production in the Union declines. In this context, the truck industry faces great difficulties in assuming these transformations. The personalized services to be financed from the EGF include career guidance, training, retraining and job search activities, as well as grants to create new businesses and promote entrepreneurship. Although these aids are not capable by themselves of alleviating the drama of growing unemployment in the Finnish electronics industry, they do constitute good assistance and allow the provision of training for the labor reintegration of affected workers

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report in order to support the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) for Volvo Trucks. 2016 February 16 The Commission has adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF to support Sweden in supporting the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant in 5 companies. This is the second application to be considered in 2016. budget, and 22nd in the motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer manufacturing sector, which involves 500 redundancies. In accordance with all the applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation, the Commission has concluded that this application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF. According to the Swedish authorities, the redundancies are due to changes that have affected the European commercial vehicle sector in recent years, in particular the truck industry, in particular the emergence of new Asian truck manufacturers and the difficulty for the truck industry to adapt to efficiency gains. and reducing costs.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is intended to provide assistance to workers made redundant as a result of globalization, major structural changes in world trade patterns, protracted global financial and economic crisis, and another global financial and economic crisis, and to self-employed workers.for reintegration into the labor market.Sweden has submitted an application to mobilize the EGF, under the reference number EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks, for a financial contribution from the EGF.The request has been examined by the committee as meeting the requirements of the relevant regulation, which is why I voted in favor of the proposal.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this document because I believe it is the Union's job to support and help those workers, such as those at the Volvo Trucks plant in Umeå, who have lost their jobs due to globalization and outsourcing practices.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is useful for providing support to redundant workers and self-employed workers whose activity has ceased as a result of major changes in the structure of world trade due to globalization, or due to the persistence of the crisisglobal financial and economic crisis or due to new economic and financial crises of a supra-regional nature.The Fund should be used to assist them in their reintegration into the labor market, updating their training and giving them financial support at the same time.The EGF should therefore be mobilized to make a financial contribution to Volvo Trucks workers who have suffered severe disruption as a result of these phenomena.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing.- This report aims to mobilize 1.793 million euros with the aim of reintegrating into the labor market 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations".Even if this text tries to hide the fact that these redundancy plans are the result of generalized free trade and savage globalization, I am in favor of this report which responds, above all, to an emergency situation.Nevertheless, it is essential to question the current ultraliberal paradigm, source of poverty and destroyer of jobs.I therefore spoke in favor of this mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: signed up. - On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal to mobilize the EGF in favor of Sweden to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant by five enterprises operating in NACE Division 29 (Revision 2); semi-trailers ”), especially in the NUTS 2 Upper Norrland (SE33) region of Sweden. The application concerns 500 redundant workers. The Swedish authorities claim that the redundancies in question are the result of developments that have affected the commercial vehicle industry in Europe in recent years, especially the truck industry, due to Asian competition and the difficulties of adapting to the industry, which is forced to increase efficiency and lower costs. I voted in favor of this report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request from Sweden - EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks), because the European Globalization Adjustment Fund It was set up to provide additional support to workers affected by major structural changes in world trade practices, and I believe that this support will remedy the imbalances in the European commercial vehicle industry, especially the truck industry.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing.- € 1 793 710 for 500 redundancies in five companies in the sector "Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers".This sector is in difficulty due to Asian competition and difficulties in adapting, which force it to increase efficiency and reduce costs.Support for workers and vote in favor!

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of this report in order to support the reintegration into the labor market of around 500 workers made redundant due to globalization by Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA, a company located in North Norrland and operating in the manufacturing sector. motor vehicles and trailers. Commercial vehicle manufacturing is no longer dominated by European manufacturers due to new Asian truck manufacturers. Heavy truck production in the Union decreased in 2014, as did exports of heavy commercial vehicles, buses and coaches (a decrease of € 6.3 billion), while overall imports of commercial vehicles into the Union increased sharply . I regret that Italian companies cannot make more use of this Fund due to the lack of support from local and national institutions. Between 2007 and 2015, Italy submitted only 15 applications to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, 3 of which in 2007, only one in 2008, zero between 2009 and 2010, 7 in 2011, 2 in 2012, zero in 2013, one in 2014 and one in 2015.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report which was concerned with an application to the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund. The report concerned the Volvo Group Truck Operation and 647 workers were being made redundant workers. The European Globalisation Fund provides financial support to groups of workers who have lost their jobs due to the impacts of globalisation and recession. The European Commission provides a portion of the fund which is then matched by the relevant government. However the fund has been subject to significant controversies in the past. Money has been used to fund existing supports for redundant workers rather than additional supports. Workers were not adequately involved in the roll out of the programmes. Worst of all, tens of millions of euros have been returned to the European Commission unspent due to failure of Government to properly run the programmes. On a number of occasions more than 40% of the EU funding for specific programmes has been returned unspent. This is absolutely unacceptable and highlights the Irish Government’s lack of action or care on such vital funding issues. This apathetic and incompetent attitude is unacceptable and id something that I will continue to raise on an EU level.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against giving EUR 1 793 710 to Swedish workers who had been made redundant. The unelected and unaccountable EU has no right to spend British taxpayers’ money in this way.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report because the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund should be mobilised in the case of the Swedish Volvo Trucks where a considerable number of workers have been recently made redundant. The redundancies had been caused by the emergence of strong competition from the Asian truck manufacturers to which the Swedish company had been unable to adjust without a significant decrease in costs. The Fund should be made available in order to help the workers who lost their jobs to help them find new employment.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing.- The report concerns the Swedish request to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for the Volvo Group Trucks problem in Sweden.The request amounts to around € 1 800 000 to help reintegrate 500 workers affected by the crisis in the truck industry, in particular Volvo Trucks and some related companies, which have been heavily affected by Asian competition in recent years.In the absence of viable alternatives to help the redundant workers, I voted in favor of mobilizing the Fund.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: in writing.- We support the report, as stated by the Swedish authorities, the fact that caused the redundancies is the developments affecting European commercial vehicles, and in particular the truck industry in recent years, namely the emerging Asian truck manufacturers and its difficultiestruck industry to adapt, forcing it to increase efficiency and reduce costs.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report as it takes care to direct part of the European funds to support a Swedish company for the protection of redundant workers.I believe that the Union has all the means to support individual countries with their businesses at this time of great economic difficulty and for this I have spoken out in favor: because I think that, where there is the possibility, it is not only necessary thatpolitics respond but act concretely.Furthermore, in this particular case, the report is aimed at the protection of workers and as a Member I could only take their side, in defense of those who are victims of this period of crisis.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ This is the second application to be examined under the 2016 budget and the 22nd for the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector and refers to the mobilisation of a total amount of EUR 1 793 710 from the EGF for Sweden. The Swedish authorities state that the event giving rise to the redundancies are the developments affecting the European commercial vehicles, and in particular the truck industry in recent years, namely with emerging Asian truck manufacturers, and the difficulties of the truck industry to adjust, forcing it to increase efficiency and decrease cost.

name: Jane COLLINS
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against giving EUR 1 793 710 to Swedish workers who had been made redundant. The unelected and unaccountable EU has no right to spend British taxpayers’ money in this way.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing.- The application under consideration relates in particular to the truck industry, which has experienced a decrease in production in recent years due to Asian competition.Specifically, this sector was the subject of 22 EGF intervention applications, of which 12 attributable to the globalization of trade and 10 to the global financial and economic crisis.While I am in favor of granting EGF assistance for the 500 workers made redundant by Volvo Trucks, I agree with the rapporteur in inviting the Commission to carefully examine cases where some EGF funds have been requested for redundancies due to redundancy strategies.relocation of businesses dictated by the search for low-cost labor.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. In the case of Volvo Trucks the conditions set out in the EGF Regulation are met and therefore Sweden is entitled to a financial contribution Apart from this instrument it would be suitable to also have Commission strategies that anticipate labour market changes so as to protect jobs and ensure skills training on the basis of comprehensive trade impact assessments.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report as it allows the mobilization of an amount of 1,793,710 euros following the dismissal of 500 workers from the Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA company in Sweden as a result of the reductions at the Umeå plant, and others177 from four suppliers and processors of products of this company (IL Logistics AB, Lemia, Caverion and Isringhausen).This mobilization of funds aims to mitigate the disastrous social consequences of the economic crisis of the capitalist system.Although these funds are not capable of solving the problems of these workers in Sweden, they at least give the possibility of alleviating a small part of the human drama.It is for all this that I have decided to vote in favor of this report

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: signed up.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund supports workers affected by major structural changes in world trade practices.I voted to direct a sum of money from the EGF in order to help a group of 500 redundant workers in Swedish factories.They will benefit from in-depth evaluations, but also from all the help needed to find a job.

name: Pál CSÁKY
text: in writing. - On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Sweden to support the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant, mainly from five companies in the Upper Norrland region of Sweden. In support of the link between the redundancies and the significant structural changes in world trade patterns as a result of globalization, Sweden argues that the production of commercial vehicles, which is a relatively small segment of the automotive industry, is no longer dominated by European and North American companies; whereas emerging Asian truck manufacturers (China, India) have access to new technologies through joint ventures with recognized Western market leaders. The application concerns 500 redundant workers and concerns almost EUR 1.8 million. Personalized services for redundant workers include a range of measures, including entrepreneurship and start-up support, education and training, and job search assistance. As the Commission has determined, on the basis of the relevant provisions of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund Regulation, that the conditions for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund are met, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) helps workers find new jobs and develop new skills when they have lost their jobs due to changes in the pattern of world trade, e.g. when a large company closes a factory or moves outside the EU, or the global financial crisis andeconomic.This application from Sweden is for the mobilization of a total of EUR 1,793,710 for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 out of 647 redundant workers, mainly in the Upper Norrland region.470 employees were made redundant by Volvo Truck Operation EMEA after a reduction at its Umeå plant, and the remaining 177 by 4 suppliers and downstream manufacturers.I fully support activities that generate growth and employment.I voted for.

name: Daniel DALTON
text: in writing. ‒ It is essential that EU expenditure is closely scrutinised on the basis of value for money for taxpayers and I do not believe the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an efficient tool that offers value for money in terms of reintegrating redundant workers back into the labour market. The United Kingdom Government has never availed itself of funding under the EGF due to its inefficiency and I believe it is time that money spent under the EGF was put to better use. For these reasons I cannot support this report.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: in writing.- This legislative report aims to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) to help Sweden which is facing layoffs in the automotive sector.Sweden has applied for a financial contribution from the EGF following redundancies in its territory at Volvo Group Truck Operations EMEA and at four downstream suppliers and producers.The Swedish government explains these layoffs by developments in international trade, and in particular the increasingly offensive role of China in the construction of commercial vehicles.A budget of 1,793,710 euros is provided for compensation and assistance with the reintegration of workers.Considering that the Union must promote the transition of its economy towards sectors which generate growth and employment, I supported this report.

name: Rachida DATI
text: in writing.- The European Commission's proposal for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) aims to enable Sweden to receive financial contributions from the EGF in order to support the reintegration into the labor market of workersdismissed.Sweden having respected the conditions for granting financial contributions from the EGF and the layoffs being due to major changes in international trade, I therefore voted in favor of this text.

name: Marielle DE SARNEZ
text: in writing.- The global economic and financial crisis has hit many sectors of European industry hard.In this context, the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, created to quickly come to the aid of employees who are victims of the crisis, is obviously useful.But beyond the one-off and specific assistance that the Fund can provide, the European Union urgently needs to put in place a real strategy to better anticipate economic change, protect SMEs, and implement an investment policy.turned towards the future, and equip itself with real instruments of trade defense.

name: Andor DELI
text: in writing. - On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Sweden to support the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant, mainly from five companies in the Upper Norrland region of Sweden. This is for the use of a total of EUR 1 793 710 for Sweden under the 2016 budget. The application concerns 500 redundant workers. Personalized services for redundant workers include the following measures: various job search activities and counseling (coaching), entrepreneurship and business start-up support, education and vocational training, job search assistance with private sector service providers, job search support. The application was presented to the Commission on 16 September 2015 and supplemented by additional information up to 11 November 2015. The Commission has determined, in accordance with the relevant provisions of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund Regulation, that the conditions for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund are met. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the EGF contribution of 1,793,710 euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 647 redundant workers in Sweden, including 470 workers from Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA and 177 others from four downstream suppliers or producers . I think it is important to intervene because the commercial vehicle manufacturing industry is no longer dominated by European and North American manufacturers, due to the emergence of Asian truck manufacturers. Indeed, exports of heavy commercial vehicles, buses and coaches fell by 11% while total imports of commercial vehicles into the Union increased by 10%. The production of heavy commercial vehicles also fell in the Union in 2014. I therefore welcome the allocation of this amount as it contributes to the financing of various measures such as help in finding a job, the allowance job search, etc.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing.- This text aims to grant aid of nearly 1.8 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations", its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden.I voted for this text which contributes to the reinstatement of the workers concerned.It should nevertheless be emphasized that the Europeanists once again deplore the effects of which they cherish the causes.Asian competition appears in this case as the main cause of these layoffs.No wonder, since Article 63 of the TFEU is the door open to mass relocations, by prohibiting the slightest restriction on the movement of capital throughout the world.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: In written form.- I always support measures that contribute to growth and job creation.However, I believe that only effective measures should be supported in this regard, and it is this fund that my group and I consider ineffective, and the ratio between the results achieved and the investment made is not at all high, to put it mildly.This report proposes an investment of EUR 1,793,710 for the reintegration of 500 workers into the labor market.I rejected this offer.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: in writing. - On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Sweden to support the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant, mainly from five companies in the Upper Norrland region of Sweden. This is for the use of a total of EUR 1 793 710 for Sweden under the 2016 budget. The application concerns 500 redundant workers. Personalized services for redundant workers include the following measures: various job search activities and counseling (coaching), entrepreneurship and business start-up support, education and vocational training, job search assistance with private sector service providers, job search support. The application was presented to the Commission on 16 September 2015 and supplemented by additional information up to 11 November 2015. The Commission has determined, in accordance with the relevant provisions of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund Regulation, that the conditions for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund are met. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Jill EVANS
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns. It is a means by which the EU can give valuable help to local economies hard hit by company closures, and so I voted in favour of this application. I regret that the UK Government has not taken advantage of this fund in Wales.

name: Fredrick FEDERLEY
text: written.- Our conviction is that wealth is created through free trade and fair competition.That is why we are in principle opposed to the European Globalization Fund, which we believe is an expression of protectionism.We have previously accepted that the fund has been used as a pure emergency measure in a time of deep economic crisis, as a way to meet people's feelings of hopelessness and the exclusion that follows in the wake of the crisis and which risks further intensifying the wave of nationalism and xenophobia that is spreading.in Europe.Especially in light of the Swedish National Audit Office's analysis, where it is believed that the fund even has a negative effect on the return to work, we believe that the fund has lost its legitimacy and should not be used anymore.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to provide additional support to workers affected by the effects of major structural changes in world trade patterns and cannot exceed the maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million.Sweden has submitted a proposal to reinstate workers made redundant by 5 companies in the field of the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the labor market.The application concerns the dismissal of 500 workers and envisages the mobilization of 1,793,710 euros.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- Vote for: aims to grant aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations", its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - This request refers to Sweden's application for the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to support 647 workers in training and job search measures, with 1.8 million euros. The European Commission recognizes that "new and emerging Asian truck manufacturers (...) now have access to new joint venture technologies with market leaders established in the West". In 2014, EU commercial vehicle production grew, thanks only to the light commercial vehicle segment, while truck production declined. Exports decreased (-10%), while imports increased (10%). Volvo's strategy "clearly illustrates a response to these trends, with the launch of optimization and cost reduction measures, while investing aggressively in Asia", with, for example, the acquisition of 45% of a Chinese company in January 2015. However, in Sweden, the Volvo group has reduced its employees by 4,000 in 4 years. Capitalism has no amendment. Also in Sweden, it is the regions with the highest unemployment rates and the lowest qualification levels that are most affected by the consequences of the deregulation and liberalization of world trade and the neoliberal policies of the EU. The report is weak, but we cannot fail to follow the concrete objective that justifies it.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. – I voted in favour in order to support both the funds for the workers and their potential reemployment and the reference to the obligation for companies to comply with their responsibility.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing.- The request concerns 647 redundancies at Volvo Trucks and four suppliers and customers from Volvo Trucks.Volvo Trucks operates in the motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer industries.However, in 2015, 500 workers lost their jobs as a result of a serious decline in the production of heavy goods vehicles in the European Union.In this particular case, an amount of EUR 1 793 710 will help former employees to find a new job.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the report supporting the work and workers of companies in difficulty due to Asian competition.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing.- I am voting against the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund: application EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks) as the money from the Adjustment Fund should be given mainly to the redundant and not to reintegration or retraining programs.We do not need skilled unemployed.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. This is the second application to be examined under the 2016 budget and the 22nd for the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector and refers to the mobilisation of a total amount of EUR 1 793 710 from the EGF for Sweden. It concerns 500 workers made redundant. The application was sent to the Commission on 16 September 2015 and supplemented by additional information up to 11 November 2015. We have concluded, in accordance with all applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation, that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF.

name: Kinga GÁL
text: in writing. - On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Sweden to support the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant, mainly from five companies in the Upper Norrland region of Sweden. This is for the use of a total of EUR 1 793 710 for Sweden under the 2016 budget. The application concerns 500 redundant workers. The personalized services to be provided to redundant workers include the following measures: various job search activities and counseling (coaching), entrepreneurship and business start-up support, education and vocational training, job search assistance with private sector service providers, job search support. The application was presented to the Commission on 16 September 2015 and supplemented by additional information up to 11 November 2015. The Commission has determined, in accordance with the relevant provisions of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund Regulation, that the conditions for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund are met. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. In accordance with Article 12 of Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 1311/2011 on the multiannual financial framework for the years 2014 to 2020 (6) and Article 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1309/2013 (7), the Fund may not exceed ( Calculated at 2011 prices) a maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million. The corresponding amounts shall be entered in the general budget of the Union as a reserve. A fundamental goal is to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers affected or made redundant as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns. Parliament has repeatedly emphasized the need to improve the added value, effectiveness and employability of the EGF as an EU instrument to support redundant workers. Parliament's resolution emphasizes the importance of general information about the EGF and the visibility of the fund. I voted in favor of the resolution.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: written.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of this Fund in light of the realization that the Swedish automobile industry and, more specifically, the Volvo company in Umea have suffered serious problems.The mobilization of this Fund will allow workers to access work alternatives.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. - I supported the resolution on the proposal for a decision of the EP and of the Council on the mobilization of a contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund of EUR 1 793 710 in relation to the redundancies of the Volvo Trucks company because I believe it is important to ensure support for workers placed in redundant in a region, that of Västerbotten, which is suffering both the crisis of Volvo and that of the related companies that depend on it. Volvo Trucks, like all companies in the commercial and heavy vehicle sector, is suffering the effects of the decrease in physical production in Europe due to competition from third countries. This is a decrease of almost 11% in European volumes against a 10% increase in vehicle imports: the sector already has 22 requests for assistance from the EGF. I think, therefore, that the financing of personalized services such as individual planning services, job search and coaching, measures for motivation and health, for entrepreneurship and business creation, education and training and allowances to find a job goes in the right direction and shows citizens the value and effectiveness of EU action.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted against the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund: Motion EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks because I consider the financial instrument as a whole to be unsuitable and inefficient.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: written.- The European Fund for Adjustment to Globalization is an important measure to support affected employers and to preserve their existence, which is endangered due to technical development, the reduction of costs and the resulting savings in jobs.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the mobilisation of EU funds - which will contribute to helping 500 former Volvo Trucks workers reintegrate into the Labour market by providing them with personalised assistance.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written. - We have voted in favor of this report, as it promotes funds intended to compensate and establish compensation measures in cases of relocation or company closures due to structural changes in the markets due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of laid-off workers, and help young people without studies or employment, this time for those affected by the reductions of the Volvo Group and its suppliers in Umeå, Sweden. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide the fact that these types of measures are "bread for today and hunger for tomorrow", while the issue of employment and relocations should have another focus of action. On the one hand, Europe needs an investment plan, different from the one it is carrying out so far, and another employment policy, to act on labor matters. Secondly, this alternative should consist of investing in future activities, especially in changing the production model, and seeking sustainability outlets for these areas.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which regards an uncontroversial mobilisation of funds.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing.- We voted in favor of the release of the funds because despite our disagreement with the logic of the European Globalization Fund, in this case it supports redundant workers.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this application for the mobilisation of the EGF for 647 workers made redundant in Volvo Trucks and its suppliers and downstream producers as a result of globalisation in the manufacture of commercial vehicles sector. This is a relatively small segment within the larger automotive industry and is no longer dominated by European manufacturers with increasing competition from Asia. In particular I welcome the fact that 40 000 new employees will be needed in the Västerbotten region and that the measures targeting workers, who regard their educational level as insufficient for the vacancies identified in the region, which require specialised education, will be provided. However it is regrettable that quite a high amount is to be spent on allowances and incentives, at the maximum allowed amount of 35% of the overall package, although they are conditional on the active participation of the targeted beneficiaries in job-search or training activities. It is also unfortunate that the Commission was unable to comply with the deadline for the completion of the assessment of this application which is not in the interest of the beneficiaries although it must be noted this was due to an exceptional shortage of staff.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this application as the implications of its success would be beneficial for Irish business.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ The EU has the necessary instruments to help workers who are suffering from major structural changes in world trade patterns. This EGAF funding shall help 500 former workers to reintegrate into the labour market.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the motion for a European Parliament resolution on the proposal for a Parliament and Council decision on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in response to a request made by Sweden (Volvo Trucks) because redundant workers need to be provided with dynamic assistance.The situation is such that European and North American commercial vehicle manufacturers have to contend with increasing competition from Asian manufacturers, and further changes and adjustments are needed to reduce production.I support the fact that the Swedish authorities provided support to the affected workers before the EGF funding was approved.In this context, I believe that financial assistance from the European Union is crucial in order to mitigate the consequences of major structural changes in world trade flows.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: in writing. - The Negrescu report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks) aims to grant aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 647 workers made redundant by Volvo Group Trucks Operations, its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden. It is striking that the report cites competition from Asian manufacturers as the main cause of these layoffs, as the EU spends its time negotiating free trade agreements with these countries, thus pulling the rope to hang us. Indeed, China has become the world number 1 in the production of commercial vehicles with a market share of 34.1%. If the EGF is a stopgap aiming to timidly disguise the consequences of the EU's trade policies, and removes the responsibility of large companies, this aid seems useful for the reintegration of workers who do not have to submit to the free-trade whims of the European Commission. I voted for this text.

name: Diane JAMES
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against giving EUR 1 793 710 to Swedish workers who had been made redundant. The unelected and unaccountable EU has no right to spend British taxpayers’ money in this way.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Victor Negrescu on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for 600 dismissed employees from the Volvo Trucks company in Sweden.The report argues that it is appropriate to mobilize the EGF in order to provide the sum of EUR 1,793,710 at the request of the Swedish government.I approved this proposal which aims to provide support to redundant employees and self-employed workers terminating their activity due to major shifts in the structure of international trade in relation to the dynamics of globalization, and to contribute to their reintegrationin the labor market.This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- The mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund concerns the 500 employees of the Volvo Trucks group in Sweden made redundant in 2015. The mobilization of this fund, for which I voted, will make it possible to offer the employees of this group supportreintegration into the labor market.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: written.- The claim submitted meets the requirements for a financial contribution to protect workers and to help them reintegrate into the labor market.That is why I am voting in favor of this report.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of mobilisation of the fund, as I support giving assistance to reintegrate workers in the labour market made redundant due to major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation and the economic crisis.

name: Ilhan KYUCHYUK
