text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. Namely in this context, we should work to mobilise the EGF in order to provide a financial contribution of EUR 1 793 710 for 470 workers made redundant in Volvo Trucks and 177 in 4 suppliers and downstream producers. Swedish authorities have provided all necessary assurance that the fund will be used effectively.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) aims to provide support for workers who, unfortunately, are losing their jobs as a result of the changes in the structure of world trade due to globalization.The transformations are generated by the global economic crisis that continues within our system, and it is by virtue of it that we must urgently provide for the reintegration into the world of work of all those who are in this state.In the present case the financial aid for training courses and the search for new jobs, which support, will go to the Swedish workers of Volvo.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: in writing. - I voted for the report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Volvo Trucks. The report aims to provide € 1.793 million in aid for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by Volvo Group Trucks Operations, its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden. It is striking that the report cites competition from Asian manufacturers as the main cause of these layoffs, as the EU spends its time negotiating free trade agreements with these countries, thus pulling the rope to hang us. Indeed, China has become the world number 1 in the production of commercial vehicles with a market share of 34.1%. If the EGF is a stopgap aimed at timidly disguising the consequences of the Union's trade policies, and relieves large companies of responsibility, this aid seems useful for the reintegration of workers who do not have to submit to the free-trade whims of the European Commission.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: in writing.- I voted for this report because it grants 1.793 million euros to help 500 workers made redundant by Volvo to reintegrate.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing.- I voted for this report.He describes a curious and tragic irony in which the European Union is forced to support the 500 of the 647 workers made redundant from Volvo Group Trucks Operations and its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden, while it continues tonegotiate free trade agreements with third countries that compete with our European manufacturers.Although EU trade policies take big business off the hook, the aid of € 1.793 million to get the workers in question back to work is useful, since they don't have to endure free madness.-swinger of the European Commission.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report as it allows the mobilization of an amount of 1,793,710 euros following the dismissal of 500 workers from the Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA company in Sweden as a result of the reductions at the Umeå plant, and others177 from four suppliers and product converters of that company (IL Logistics AB, Lemia, Caverion and Isringhausen).This mobilization of funds aims to mitigate the disastrous social consequences of the economic crisis of the capitalist system.Although these funds are not capable of solving the problems of these workers in Sweden, at least they give the possibility of alleviating a small part of the human drama.It is for all this that I have decided to vote in favor of this report

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: written.- The objective of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund was to provide additional help to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns.I support the request that it be used for the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant in five companies operating in the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the Swedish region of North Norrland.I therefore give my vote in favor of the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council for the transfer of this fund to the cause previously described.He relied on the exhaustive evaluation carried out by the EC, where it is assured, of the good investment of the same and of the difficulties that the sector has suffered to adapt in recent years.

name: Petr MACH
text: in writing.- I voted against.I do not agree with spending EUR 1.7 million on subsidizing a failing company and its employees in Sweden.I am generally opposed to the existence of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.If the money distributed by the fund remained in people's pockets, it would be better for the economy.In my opinion, this fund is contrary to the principle of subsidiarity and involves interference in the social policy of individual countries.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: written. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is an instrument that provides a form of assistance to people who have lost their jobs due to the impact of globalization, structural changes or the consequences of the economic crisis. The purpose of the EGF is to enable the unemployed to find work as quickly as possible, but it can also serve the self-employed, temporary and temporary workers. EGF can be used to help with counseling, training for other occupations and education, creating entrepreneurial and business opportunities. In September 2015, Sweden applied for a financial contribution from the EGF to lay off 647 workers, 470 of whom were declared redundant at Volvo Trucks. The main reason for the layoffs is the emergence of Asian truck manufacturers forcing Volvo Trucks to cut costs and increase efficiency in order to compete. The EGF is eligible for 500 of the 647 redundancies and will be subject to measures linked to various activities such as active job search measures, education and training measures, the provision of private job search assistance, various job search allowances. and similar. I supported the report because I believe that the EGF is a key instrument with which it is possible to help redundant workers and respond to global challenges.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: in writing.- Almost two months ago, the European Commission decided to support 5 redundant workers in Sweden in the car, trailer and semi-trailer industry.As part of this support, Sweden will receive a total of EUR 1 793 710 for the retraining, various forms of support and the gradual reintegration into the labor market of 500 former workers.One of the main reasons why this support became necessary was that in recent years the European commercial vehicle industry, especially trucks, has been affected by the development of similar companies in Asia, with which it is quite difficult to compete due to lower wage costs.I supported this funding in order to enable the redundant workers to return to the labor market as soon as possible, thus contributing to the further development of the vehicle manufacturing sector.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (requested by Sweden - EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks), because it is complete and substantiated.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: in writing.- I voted for this text.The Negrescu report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) aims to grant aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 to 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations", its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden.This report points to competition with low-cost Asian countries.At the same time, the European Union continues to negotiate and conclude free trade agreements with these states.Of course, this measure would deal with the consequences, and not the causes, of this tragedy of savage liberalism, but, on a human level, we are in favor of helping these workers.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund is an indispensable tool with which the European Union can effectively intervene in support of workers who have lost their jobs due to the economic and financial crisis.The proposal aims to support the reintegration into the labor market of the 500 redundant employees of Volvo Group Trucks, a company operating in the vehicle and trailer manufacturing sector, and downstream producers in Sweden.For this reason, I voted in favor.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: written.- My support for the proposal to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for an amount of 1.7 million euros in order to provide EU assistance in the face of the situation in Sweden with the redundancies at VolvoTrucks and four suppliers and product converters in Sweden.Thus, we are going to help provide a viable solution to about 500 workers affected by this circumstance, just as we proposed with the creation of this Fund.

name: Mairead McGUINNESS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in in favour of releasing European funds to enable works to adapt to recent changes.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing.- At the end of 2014, a Volvo truck production site in Sweden closes and dismisses nearly 650 workers.At the start of 2015, Volvo bought 45% of a Chinese company and continued to relocate without ever being worried.Worse, the report even excuses it.It's not his fault, the layoffs are "driven by the need to increase efficiency and cut costs in order to face current and future global competition."And the Commission added: "structural changes are necessary to maintain profitability in the European truck market".If it does not want to talk about the dumping policy encouraged by the Union, ad minima, the report would be required to highlight these contradictions.Volvo Group is net profits multiplied by seven in 2015 and the 2nd world leader in heavy goods vehicles.I am voting against this real subsidy for relocations.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing.- This report aims to reintegrate into the market 500 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations".Beyond the bad faith of the text which attributes these layoffs to Chinese competition, it seems to me that this stopgap has a use for the reinstatement of these employees.Consequently I voted for this text

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. - The EU is an area of ​​solidarity and it is part of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. This support is essential for helping the unemployed and the victims of relocation in a globalized context. There is an increasing number of companies relocating, taking advantage of the low labor prices that are practiced in several countries, namely in China and India, with harmful effects for countries that respect workers' rights. The EGF is intended to help workers who are victims of company relocation, and is essential to facilitate access to a new job. The EGF has already been used in the past by other EU countries, and it is now up to Sweden to provide this aid, which submitted the application 'EFG / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks' to a financial contribution from the EGF, following redundancies economic activity sector classified in Division 29 of NACE Rev. 2 (Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers), mainly in the NUTS level 2 region of northern Norrland (SE33), with an estimated 500 of the 647 eligible redundant workers contribution from the EGF to participate in the measures.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) is one of the tools at the Union’s disposal to provide additional assistance to workers negatively impacted upon by major structural changes in world trade patterns. The Commission approved this specific application as it met the conditions for mobilising EGF to support the local economy. I therefore voted in favour of this report to help address the situation of the workers in this automotive sector.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: in writing. - I supported Sweden's request for a financial contribution amounting to EUR 1 793 710 in commitment and payment appropriations from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund following the layoffs in the sector business in the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers, in the region of North Norrland. This contribution will help 500 of the 647 workers made redundant. 470 workers were made redundant at Volvo Group Truck Operations following restrictions at the Umeå plant, and 177 others were made redundant at four suppliers or downstream producers (IL Logistics AB, Lemia, Caverion and Isringhausen) . The maximum annual budget of the Fund is 150 million euros for the period 2014-2020. It can contribute up to 60% of the cost of projects intended to help people who have lost their jobs to find work or to set up their own business.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) provides support to people who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade due to globalization. The last ten years, since we first felt the effects of the financial crisis, we have seen that changes of this kind also affect large and stable companies, often affecting manufacturing plants, and the car industry in particular. As a rule, EGF funds can only be granted to a specific company if more than 500 workers are lost, not only the employees of the primary company, but also the employees of other related companies, such as suppliers and downstream producers. Sweden's application EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks states that there are 647 redundant workers in this case. Sweden has also fulfilled all other obligations related to the provision of EGF funds. It follows that Sweden is entitled to EUR 1 793 710, which is why I am voting in favor of the report. I would also like to remind the Commission to provide all the necessary information on the EGF so that applicants do not have difficult access to the necessary documents. It is also important that there are no unnecessary delays in deciding on contributions, as was the case with Volvo Trucks.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour on this report giving the green light for the mobilisation of this European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGAF) related to 647 redundancies in Volvo Trucks and 4 suppliers and downstream producers of Volvo Trucks, operating in the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers, within the reference period 24 February 2015 - 24 June 2015. The EGAF funding shall contribute to help 500 former workers.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund is intended to provide additional support for workers who suffer from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. At 2011 prices, the fund may not exceed a maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million. On 16 September 2015, Sweden submitted an application to mobilize the Fund, amounting to EUR 1 793 710, for 470 employees and 4 suppliers and processors at the Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA plant in Umeå (IL Logistics AB, Lemia, Caverion and Isringhausen). due to the dismissal of 177 people. The Commission has determined that the application meets the conditions laid down in Article 4 (1) (a) of the EGF Regulation and that Sweden is therefore eligible for the aid requested. It also noted that the application complies with the requirements for determining the financial contributions from the EGF as laid down in Article 13 of Regulation (EU) No 1309/2013, and therefore submits a proposal for a decision to the Parliament and Council to approve the mobilization of EUR 1 793 710. from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. In its report, the Committee on Budgets proposes that Parliament approve the Commission proposal and contribute EUR 1 793 710 to the EGF, following a request from Sweden. I supported the proposal.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: in writing. - The report aims to grant aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 of the 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations", its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden. It is striking that the report cites competition from Asian manufacturers as the main cause of these layoffs, as the EU spends its time negotiating free trade agreements with these countries, thus pulling the rope to hang us. Indeed, China has become the world number 1 in the production of commercial vehicles with a market share of 34.1%. If this fund is a stopgap aiming to timidly disguise the consequences of the Union's trade policies, and removes the responsibility of large companies, this aid seems useful for the reintegration of workers who do not have to suffer the consequences of free trade policies. of the European Commission.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing.- The Union has created legislative and budgetary instruments to provide complementary support to workers affected by the effects of major structural changes in world trade patterns or the global economic and financial crisis, as well as to assist their reintegration into the labor market.I vote in favor of this report, which claims that 40,000 new workers will be needed in the Västerbotten region, welcoming measures targeted at workers who consider that their level of education is not sufficient for the job openings identified in the region, which require trainingspecific.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing. - The Negrescu report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks) aims to grant aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 647 workers made redundant by "Volvo Group Trucks Operations", its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden. It is striking that the report cites competition from Asian manufacturers as the main cause of these layoffs, as the Union spends its time negotiating free trade agreements with these countries, thus pulling the rope to hang us. Indeed, China has become the world number 1 in the production of commercial vehicles with a market share of 34.1%. If the EGF is a stopgap aiming to timidly disguise the consequences of the Union's trade policies, and removes the responsibility of large companies, this aid seems useful for the reintegration of workers who do not have to submit to the free-trade whims of the European Commission. I voted for this text.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this mobilisation of funds because the case fully meets the requirements set out in the European Globalisation Adjustment Regulation.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report, which aims to grant financial assistance of € 1,793,710, within the framework of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, to Sweden for the company Volvo Trucks which made redundancieseconomy, 647 people between February 24, 2015 and June 24, 2015. This fund, created in 2006, aims to help people who have lost their jobs following major structural changes in international trade due to theglobalization (relocation, business closure, etc.), in their job search or in their professional retraining.

name: Elisabeth MORIN-CHARTIER
text: in writing. - The European Parliament adopted two mobilization reports for the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. I spoke in favor of each of its two reports. The objective of this fund is to allow employees who have been made redundant to have personalized training so that they can retrain professionally. On this file, the European Parliament has given its approval for the release of 1,793,710 euros from this fund for 647 beneficiaries who are dismissed employees of the Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA company in Sweden. In this difficult period, the mobilization of this Fund is essential. It is imperative that personalized training be provided to those made redundant so that they can return to employment as quickly as possible. The European Parliament is once again showing its attachment to one of the founding values ​​of the European Union: solidarity.

name: Renaud MUSELIER
text: in writing.- I supported Sweden's request for recourse to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to allow compensation for Swedish employees.The request met the conditions for access to the EGF, and as such did not give rise to any legitimate challenge.

name: József NAGY
text: in writing. - In a rapidly changing global world, many unforeseen circumstances can lead to changes in the labor market, profound structural changes in world trade, economic crisis, or other external causes can cause many people to lose their jobs at once. Regions where a sector of the economy provides a large number of jobs are particularly vulnerable, making it difficult for people who have lost their jobs to find new ones. I believe that the globalization fund was created along a good idea. Further training for the unemployed has a positive effect on the labor market and can create a competitive workforce, thus helping the region's economy - but it is important to emphasize that its task is not to correct globalization and the global crisis, but to provide assistance. In many cases, large corporations are unable to compete with competition from abroad (in this case, Asian commercial vehicle manufacturers), which often enjoy high levels of government support from home. It is to be welcomed that Sweden started to provide the necessary personalized services long before the decision to grant EGF support. We can therefore be sure that the aid is used effectively and efficiently.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ On the 16th of September 2015 Sweden has submitted an application to the European Commission requesting a contribution of almost EUR 1.8 million from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund to help 500 workers of Volvo Trucks made redundant in Västerbotten province in the north of Sweden. Volvo Trucks Umeå plant and four other suppliers were affected by these redundancies. Arctic labour markets in small populated areas are more fragile due to their geographical isolation and severe weather conditions thus making job creation and employment more costly than other areas. Redundancies like the one in Västerbotten´s province Umeå plant bring a major shock to the regional economy. I have voted for this report that will help and support the workers made redundant to find jobs by upgrading their skills, preparing them for new opportunities, providing them with guidance, training, job-search support, advice on entrepreneurship and business creation, as well as job-search allowances and travel expenses.

name: Dan NICA
text: signed up. - I voted in favor of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in favor of Sweden, following the redundancies in the car and trailer manufacturing sector by Volvo Trucks. It is expected that 500 of the 647 redundant workers who are eligible for EGF contributions will participate in these measures. 470 of the workers were made redundant by Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA due to staff reductions, and the other 177 were made redundant by four suppliers and downstream manufacturers. Unfortunately, both the production of heavy trucks in the Union decreased in 2014 and the exports of commercial vehicles of tonnage, buses and coaches (a decrease of EUR 6.3 billion and 11% respectively), and global imports of commercial vehicles in Union increased (by 10%). We call on the Member States to work with the social partners on strategies to anticipate expected changes in the labor market and to protect jobs and skills in the Union, based on comprehensive trade impact assessments carried out by the Commission for each trade agreement.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: written.- I voted in favor of this motion because the conditions for mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund have been met.The economic damage caused by the 470 layoffs at Volvo and 177 layoffs at suppliers or downstream companies can be cushioned accordingly.

name: Margot PARKER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against giving EUR 1 793 710 to Swedish workers who had been made redundant. The unelected and unaccountable EU has no right to spend British taxpayers’ money in this way.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the European Parliament motion for a resolution, as I believe that the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in favor of 500 redundant Swedish workers, together with the actions proposed by the Swedish government in favor of these workers, falls withinwithin the scope of the relevant Fund.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: written. - Over the last year, we have voted in favor of numerous decisions on the use of the European Fund to help workers who found themselves in an unenviable position during the global financial and economic crisis. Major structural changes in world trade flows caused by globalization and the continuation of the global financial and economic crisis have led to significant losses this time as well - this time Volvo in Sweden. As many as 647 Volvo workers have been declared redundant. I support the request of the Swedish authorities to be granted a financial contribution from the Globalization Adjustment Fund in the amount of EUR 1,793,710 per 500 workers. It should be noted that redundant workers are likely to encounter difficulties in finding work because they do not possess the competencies required in the regional labor market. Therefore, the project will need to work closely with education and employment organizations to promote business start-ups and improve the skills and competencies of jobseekers to meet the needs of the future employer. Since the region is large, users may also have to travel a lot. This financial assistance is therefore needed to alleviate the disadvantages of redundant workers and enable their reintegration into the labor market.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing. - The Negrescu report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks) aims to grant aid of 1.793 million euros for the reintegration into the labor market of 500 647 workers made redundant by Volvo Group Trucks Operations, its four suppliers and subcontractors in Sweden. It is striking that the report cites competition from Asian manufacturers as the main cause of these layoffs, as the EU spends its time negotiating free trade agreements with these countries, thus pulling the rope to hang us. Indeed, China has become the world number 1 in the production of commercial vehicles with a market share of 34.1%. If the EGF is a stopgap aimed at timidly disguising the consequences of the Union's trade policies, and relieves large companies of responsibility, this aid seems useful for the reintegration of workers who do not have to submit to the free-trade whims of the European Commission. I therefore vote in favor of this report.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: written. - The aim of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is to provide support to redundant and self-employed workers who have ceased their activities due to major structural changes in world trade flows due to globalization, as a result of the continuing global financial and economic crisis or as a consequence new global and economic crises and providing assistance for their reintegration into the labor market. I welcome the Commission's proposal to mobilize the EGF in favor of Sweden to support the reintegration into the labor market of a total of 500 affected workers who have been declared redundant in the motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer sector. With the advent of Asian truck manufacturers, the European truck industry has found itself in difficulties, being forced to increase efficiency and reduce costs. I therefore welcome these EGF measures and consider them necessary to help those who have suffered layoffs at Volvo Group Truck Operation EME and to enable them to return to the labor market as soon and easily as possible.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. - This request refers to Sweden's application for the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to support 647 workers in training and job search measures, with 1.8 million euros. The European Commission recognizes that "new and emerging Asian truck manufacturers (...) now have access to new joint venture technologies with market leaders established in the West". In 2014, EU commercial vehicle production grew, thanks only to the light commercial vehicle segment, while truck production declined. Exports decreased (-10%), while imports increased (10%). Volvo's strategy "clearly illustrates a response to these trends, with the launch of optimization and cost reduction measures, while aggressively investing in Asia", with, for example, the acquisition of 45% of a Chinese company in January 2015. However, in Sweden, the Volvo group has reduced its employees by 4,000 in 4 years. Capitalism has no amendment. Also in Sweden, it is the regions with the highest unemployment rates and the lowest levels of qualification that are most affected by the consequences of deregulation and liberalization of world trade and EU neoliberal policies. The report is weak, but we cannot fail to follow the concrete objective that justifies it.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: written.- Globalization has caused major structural changes in world trade flows.The consequences of job losses at Volvo will have a major impact on the sector and the region.Laying off 647 workers is a challenge, especially for older workers from the target group as they will face difficulties in finding a job due to not having the competencies required in the regional labor market.I believe that support is needed for workers who have been declared redundant and self-employed who have stopped working because of these major structural changes, and that is the purpose of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.Consequently, I support my colleague Victor Negrescu's report on the mobilization of EUR 1 793 710, which represents 60% of the total cost.

name: Pavel POC
text: in writing. - I supported the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for the Kingdom of Sweden. In this Member State, there have been massive redundancies who will have to be reintegrated into the local labor market. The production and export of heavy trucks and commercial vehicles in the European Union has been replaced by production in Asia. This is evidenced by statistical data confirming the European decline of up to a tenth and, conversely, the rising trend in Asian markets. The critical situation in vehicle production in Europe is further confirmed by the fact that the provision of assistance from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund has already been the subject of 22 applications. Sweden has met all the necessary formal criteria that entitle it to receive the necessary assistance of around EUR 1.8 million. Assistance from the European Union in this particular case should optimally complement the measures taken by the Swedish authorities after the redundancies in 2015 to support the return of the redundant workers to an optimal supply and demand situation in the labor market.

name: Miroslav POCHE
text: in writing.- As a Social Democrat, I must express my support for this decision by the European Parliament, which leads to greater solidarity within the European Union.I was very pleased that the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) was set up at one time, which provides additional assistance to workers who have been affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade.However, I hope that this European financial instrument will not replace the Member State's obligations in the field of the labor market or passive social protection measures, and at the same time I expect Members of the European Parliament to be fully informed about the complementarity of these measures financed by the EGF.I firmly believe that this decision will lead to much better security for redundant Volvo Trucks workers so that they do not have to be on the margins of society.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing.- I welcome the mobilization of the EGF in connection with the application EGF / 2015/009 SE / submitted by Sweden to provide a financial contribution to Volvo Trucks.Unfortunately, the business car manufacturing sector has experienced severe economic disruption, notably a sharp drop in the EU market share.Due to the difficult economic situation of the car manufacturing sector in the EU, with a significant decline in sales of new cars, some car manufacturers and their suppliers have been forced to close factories and renovate which have resulted in a large number ofjob losses.I hope that mobilization of the EGF will allow the timely reintegration of Volvo employees into the labor market.

name: Franck PROUST
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), created in 2006, helps people who have lost their jobs as a result of structural changes in international trade, such as relocations or business closures.companies.Here, it is the Swedish company Volvo Trucks which requested the EGF and I supported the European participation up to 60% of the project which will aim in particular to support former employees in their job search or forlaunch of an activity.The fight for employment is a constant struggle and Europe acts, within the limits of its competence, to provide support which will allow citizens affected by unemployment to quickly reintegrate into working life.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against giving EUR 1 793 710 to Swedish workers who had been made redundant. The unelected and unaccountable EU has no right to spend British taxpayers’ money in this way.

name: Sofia RIBEIRO
text: in writing. - On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) in favor of Sweden, in order to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant by 5 companies that work in the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the northern region of Norrland, Sweden. After submitting the application, the Commission concluded that it meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF. This is the second application to be examined under the 2016 budget and the 22nd for the area in question, and concerns the mobilization of a total amount of EUR 1 793 710 from the EGF in favor of Sweden and the dismissal of 500 workers. The Swedish authorities claim that the redundancies are at the root of the developments that have affected the European commercial vehicle segment, especially the heavy vehicle industry in recent years, notably due to the appearance of new truck manufacturers from Asia, and the industry's difficulties in adjust, forcing it to increase efficiency and reduce costs. My vote was positive.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: written. - I voted in favor of this report to approve the mobilization of € 1,793,710 from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for 500 workers who have lost their jobs at Volvo Trucks and four suppliers and product processors in Sweden, as a result of the major structural changes in world trade patterns brought about by globalization. Commercial vehicle manufacturing is no longer dominated by European and North American manufacturers as new truck manufacturers are emerging in Asia while heavy truck production in the Union declines. In this context, the truck industry faces great difficulties in assuming these transformations. The personalized services to be financed from the EGF include career guidance, training, retraining and job search activities, as well as grants to create new businesses and promote entrepreneurship. Although these aids are not capable by themselves of alleviating the drama of growing unemployment in the Finnish electronics industry, they do constitute good assistance and allow the provision of training for the labor reintegration of affected workers

name: Claude ROLIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) to the tune of € 1,793,710 to help the 647 workers made redundant at Volvo and its subcontractors in Sweden.The commercial vehicle construction industry faces significant competition due to the emergence of Asian truck manufacturers.European producers are seeing their exports decrease while imports of this type of vehicle on the European market are only increasing.As a result, some companies such as Volvo are forced to lay off staff, which is not without impact for their many subcontractors.It is therefore important to help these workers in order in particular to increase their skills and thus help them to find a job and a stable social situation as quickly as possible.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report in order to provide support from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) to Volvo Trucks.The support will affect 500 workers made redundant from five companies and help them return to the labor market.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing.- This report concerns a proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), in favor of Sweden, for a total amount of EUR 1 793 710, to cover 470continuous redundancies at the Volvo company and another 177 from four downstream suppliers and producers, operating in the economic sector for the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the Norrland region in Sweden.From the analysis to the report, the EGF mobilization criteria are met and, being aware of the difficulties that the automotive sector has faced in recent years and the profound impact that this situation has been having on the communities and their local economies, I voted in favor.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: written. - We have voted in favor of this report, as it promotes funds intended to compensate and establish compensation measures in cases of relocation or company closures due to structural changes in the markets due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of laid-off workers, and help young people without studies or employment, this time for those affected by the reductions of the Volvo Group and its suppliers in Umeå, Sweden. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide that these types of measures are "bread for today and hunger for tomorrow", while the issue of employment and relocations should have another focus of action. On the one hand, Europe needs an investment plan, different from the one it is carrying out so far, and another employment policy, to act on labor matters. Secondly, this alternative should consist of investing in future activities, especially in changing the production model, and seeking sustainability outlets for these areas.

name: Daciana Octavia SÂRBU
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of the Negrescu Report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to support EUR 500 million of the 500 employees made redundant by Volvo Trucks in Sweden.I believe that the European Union must support the redundant workers as a result of the relocation of companies, and I hope that, in the case of the workers in Oltenița, a support solution will be found as soon as possible.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report as it allows the mobilization of an amount of 1,793,710 euros following the dismissal of 500 workers from the Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA company in Sweden as a result of the reductions at the Umeå plant, and others177 from four suppliers and product converters of that company (IL Logistics AB, Lemia, Caverion and Isringhausen).This mobilization of funds aims to mitigate the disastrous social consequences of the economic crisis of the capitalist system.Although these funds are not capable of solving the problems of these workers in Sweden, at least they give the possibility of alleviating a small part of the human drama.It is for all this that I have decided to vote in favor of this report

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ This procedure relates to the mobilisation of much-needed funding for the re-integration of 500 workers who were made redundant from Volvo Group Truck Operation EMEA. I have always supported use of the EGF, and it is sickening that the Tory Government refuses to apply for the funding when there has been just cause for its use.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing.- I fully support measures aimed at setting policies that create growth and jobs.However, I do not consider the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to be the right and effective tool for these policies.That is why I voted against.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report, but this explanation of vote arises as a critique of the current system of evaluating the work of MPs in the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities emphasized in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual qualityactions.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created to provide additional support for workers who suffer from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. On 16 February 2016, the Commission adopted a decision to mobilize the EGF in favor of Sweden to support the reintegration of redundant workers in five motor vehicle, semi-trailer and trailer companies. It concerns about 500 redundant workers. According to the Swedish authorities, the reason for the redundancies has been developments in recent years affecting European commercial vehicle production, in particular the truck sector. Redundant workers will be provided with job search and counseling assistance, job search assistance with private service providers, travel and related expenses, job search allowance, education and training, and self-employment and business start-up assistance. The total financial amount for such assistance to 500 redundant workers is EUR 1 793 710 from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: in writing.- Since 2014, there has been a decline in truck production in the EU and an increase in imports due to the evolving Asian production.This trend has caused economic problems for many European producers, leading to mass redundancies.That is why the EU has set up the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.In this practical way, Parliament provides assistance to redundant workers in their reintegration into the labor market.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: written.- The European Union has established legislative and budgetary instruments to support workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns and the global financial and economic crisis with a view to their reintegration into the labor market.On 16 September 2015, Sweden applied for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) following the redundancies of a large number of redundant workers at Volvo Trucks and four suppliers and downstream manufacturers in Sweden.Sweden fulfills the conditions of the EGF Regulation and is therefore entitled to a financial contribution of 60% of the total cost.The EGF should be mobilized to provide the necessary financial contribution.I therefore supported this request.

name: Catherine STIHLER
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which regards an uncontroversial mobilisation of funds.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: written. - 647 workers were laid off by 24 June 2015 at Volvo Trucks and its 4 suppliers and downstream manufacturers. On 16 September 2015, Sweden applied for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. Due to the impact of globalization, Asian vehicle manufacturers are getting closer to the former leaders of the commercial vehicle sector (North America, Japan and Europe). The development of commercial vehicle manufacturers from third countries has led to an increase in EU commercial vehicle imports by 10.7%. All this led to the dismissal of workers in Sweden. I support the request to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. I believe that it is necessary to help workers who have been made redundant due to the changes caused by globalization and to reintegrate them into the labor market. In addition, the redundancies affect the commercial vehicle production sector and the region as a whole. This not only supports the European economy, but also cares for the citizens of the European Union and reduces the high unemployment rate.

name: Richard SULÍK
text: in writing.- I did not support the proposal.The subsidization of persons who have become unemployed as a result of low competitiveness is based exclusively on the taxes of entities that are competitive.Thus, the more the European Union corrects the consequences of a lack of competitiveness in this way, the more it reduces the EU's competitiveness.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund - Volvo Trucks.The financial contribution from the EGF of EUR 1 793 710, which is 60% of the total cost, will be sufficient for actions involving 500 of the 647 redundancies.This is an area where most vacancies are tied to highly skilled workers, and laid-off workers have only a high school education.We need measures for redundant workers to gain specialized skills to make it easier to compete for vacancies.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: in writing.- Although we disagree with the logic of the European Globalization Fund, we voted in favor of the release of the funds because they support redundant workers through various programs.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: in writing.- Adjustment Fund money should be given primarily to those laid off and not to reintegration or retraining programs.We do not need skilled unemployed.

name: Adam SZEJNFELD
text: in writing. - The work of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is extremely important to maintaining the competitiveness of European workers in the labor market. The fund supports redundant workers from large enterprises, who are often the main employer in the region, offering them the possibility not only to improve their qualifications within a given profession, but also to completely retrain. In the case of Volvo's Umeå plant, the layoffs were due to a decline in production and exports of heavy trucks to new Asian manufacturers. Moreover, the region whose capital city is Umeå is known for its highly skilled industries, while most of the dismissed workers have only secondary education. The mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund was therefore necessary in this case. However, it should be remembered that globalization also has a huge impact on the functioning of small and medium-sized enterprises. Unfortunately, they cannot count on such generous help, even though they employ more people in total and account for a greater percentage of GDP than individual large enterprises. It would therefore be advisable to create a similar support mechanism for European SMEs.

name: Claudia ȚAPARDEL
text: signed up. - On 16 September 2015, the Swedish authorities submitted a request to mobilize a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) in order to facilitate the redeployment and re-employment of 647 redundant workers in Volvo Trucks and of four downstream suppliers and producers in Sweden. These redundancies are the result of developments that have affected the commercial vehicle industry in Europe in recent years, in particular the truck industry, due to Asian competition and the difficulties of adapting to this industry. I support the Commission's decision to mobilize the EGF in favor of Sweden to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant by five companies involving the mobilization from the EGF of a total amount of EUR 1 793 710 for Sweden. I believe that this measure is especially necessary for the automotive, trailer and semi-trailer industry, which is adjusting more slowly to major structural changes in global trade practices caused by globalization.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the text.I can only regret that the Commission was not able to complete the examination of this request on time.It should be remembered that, in the interest of the beneficiaries, aid should be made available as quickly and efficiently as possible.Member States and Union institutions participating in the implementation of the EGF should do their utmost to reduce processing time and simplify procedures so as to ensure the rapid and smooth adoption of decisions relating to the mobilization of the EGF.FEM!

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this measure which will enable Volvo’s workers in Sweden, who lost their job due to the rapid changes induced by globalisation, to reintegrate the labour market as quickly and efficiently as possible. Through this fund, the workers will be provided with training, guidance, job-search facilitation, transfer of experiences, support for enterprise creation and collective projects, as well as job-search and training allowances. I believe that this is an important instrument to alleviate the sometimes harsh consequences of globalisation, reduce unemployment periods to their maximum, encourage labour flexibility and thus increase the competitiveness and sustainability of European market.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: written.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund provides support to people who have lost their jobs as a result of significant structural changes in world trade flows due to globalization, such as the closure of large companies or relocation of production outside the EU, or the global economic and financial crisis.Under this program, Sweden has applied for a financial contribution of € 1,793,710 following the redundancies of 647 workers in the Volvo Group Truck Operation in the Upper Norrland area.While I support all measures for job creation and growth, I believe that the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is not an effective tool for reintegrating workers into the labor market, and I voted against this report.

name: Romana TOMC
text: in writing. - I supported the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (application EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks, Sweden). The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. The Swedish authorities have provided all necessary assurances regarding the following: access to and implementation of the proposed measures will respect the principles of equal treatment and non-discrimination, compliance with the requirements of national and EU collective redundancy law, Volvo Trucks continued its activities, fulfilled its legal obligations regarding redundancies and took appropriate care of them, the proposed measures will not receive financial support from other Union funds or financial instruments and double funding will be avoided, the proposed measures will complement actions financed by funds, the financial contribution from the EGF will be aligned with the Union's procedural and substantive State aid rules. Sweden has informed the Commission that the EGF measures will be co-financed by the Swedish government through the budget of the Swedish Public Employment Service (Arbetsförmedlingen).

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: written. - We have voted in favor of this report, as it promotes funds intended to compensate and establish compensation measures in cases of relocation or company closures due to structural changes in the markets due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of laid-off workers, and help young people without studies or employment, this time for those affected by the reductions of the Volvo Group and its suppliers in Umeå, Sweden. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide that these types of measures are "bread for today and hunger for tomorrow", while the issue of employment and relocations should have another focus of action. On the one hand, Europe needs an investment plan, different from the one it is carrying out so far, and another employment policy, to act on labor matters. Secondly, this alternative should consist of investing in future activities, especially in changing the production model, and seeking sustainability outlets for these areas.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: in writing.- This report is acceptable because it allows 500 workers to be reintegrated into the labor market.However, I notice that he is doing everything to hide the weaknesses of European policy.Indeed, if Volvo Trucks laid off its workers, it was because the Chinese competition was too strong, and this because of a partnership policy led by the European Union.I vote for this report, reminding that prevention is better than cure.

name: István UJHELYI
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns.This is the second application to be examined under the 2016 budget and the 22nd for the production of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers and the mobilization of a total amount of EUR 1 793 710 from the EGF for Sweden.The application concerns 500 redundant workers.I supported it with my vote.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: written. - We have voted in favor of this report, as it promotes funds intended to compensate and establish compensation measures in cases of relocation or company closures due to structural changes in the markets due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of laid-off workers, and help young people without studies or employment, this time for those affected by the reductions of the Volvo Group and its suppliers in Umeå, Sweden. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide that these types of measures are "bread for today and hunger for tomorrow", while the issue of employment and relocations should have another focus of action. On the one hand, Europe needs an investment plan, different from the one it is carrying out so far, and another employment policy, to act on labor matters. Secondly, this alternative should consist of investing in future activities, especially in changing the production model, and seeking sustainability outlets for these areas.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: written.- I voted in favor of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in the case of the Volvo plant in Sweden.This fund is a fundamental tool to alleviate the effects of industrial relocation processes.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: written.- We are talking about a fund that is dedicated to processing transfers of funds to meet severance pay for maximum layoffs for the cessation of different business activities in the Member States.In this case we are talking about a transfer that is to some extent cushion the redundancies that occurred at Volvo Trucks and at four suppliers and transformers in Sweden in 2015. It is therefore appropriate to vote in favor of this report.

name: Anneleen VAN BOSSUYT
text: written.- Globalization is inevitable and goes hand in hand with the opening of new markets, with international competition, with economic growth and with job creation that exceeds job losses in less competitive sectors.Consequently, there is a particular need for structural reforms for sustainable economic growth.This requires economic customization combined with an appropriate social policy for which, also in line with the Treaties, the member states are the first and most appropriate authorities to be competent.The N-VA delegation in the European Parliament understands the objectives of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), but is convinced that a European transfer union cannot be a remedy to tackle unemployment, nor a much neededstructural reform policy.The N-VA MEPs have therefore voted against this report.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: written.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund as it will help Volvo Sweden workers, who lost their jobs due to rapid changes caused by globalization, to reintegrate into the labor market as soon as possible.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. - This request refers to Sweden's application to the European Globalization Fund to support 647 workers in training and job search measures, with 1.8 million euros. According to the Commission's communication, Volvo's strategy "clearly illustrates a response to these trends, with the launch of optimization and cost reduction measures, while aggressively investing in Asia", with, for example, the acquisition of 45 % of a Chinese company, completed in January 2015. However, in Sweden, the Volvo group has reduced its employees by 4,000 in 4 years. The report does not question the EU's industrial and commercial policy, although it duly notes that the high number of EGF mobilizations related to this sector justifies the change and Volvo's Asian strategy: "partial relocation (...) is driven by the need to increase efficiency and decrease costs to face existing and expected global competition ". The Commission's position follows, stating that "structural changes are necessary to maintain profitability in the European truck market", and that these changes can benefit customers through "greater pressure on prices."

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: written.- As the application submitted for the use of the EGF meets all the requirements for a financial contribution, I have approved the report.

name: Beatrix von STORCH
text: written.- I did not agree to the resolution of the European Parliament on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on mobilizing the EGF (application by Sweden - EGF / 2015/009 SE / Volvo Trucks).The fund should be closed.It is absurd to adopt rescue measures for sole proprietorship at EU level.That is at least a violation of the subsidiarity principle and also a violation of economic policy lessons.

name: Marco ZANNI
text: in writing. - We have today voted on a request to mobilize the EGF for a problem affecting Volvo Group Truck in Sweden. The Swedish request amounts to around € 1 800 000 to help the reintegration of 500 workers affected by the crisis in the truck industry, in particular Volvo Trucks and some related companies, which have been heavily affected by Asian competition in recent years in this sector . The objective of technical assistance is to finance monitoring and information, to create a knowledge base / interface and to provide advice to Member States on the use, continuity and evaluation of the EGF. I am generally in favor of mobilizing this fund, although I am aware that it is probably not the instrument that can best help the redundant workers, but in the absence of valid alternatives I still believe that it should be supported; therefore I cast my positive vote.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: in writing. - I did not support Sweden's request to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in connection with the collective redundancies of Volvo Trucks employees who have become redundant as a result of globalization trade changes. As I have said in other requests for its mobilization, I do not consider this fund to be an appropriate instrument for helping redundant workers made redundant. I think that the assistance from this fund comes a long time after the application for its use has been made, and in particular, despite the latest evaluation report, there is no consensus on its effectiveness. First of all, it is necessary to collect a sufficient amount of accurate data and, in particular, a comparative study, so that we can determine the impact of providing this funding. I am of the opinion that before we recklessly give money from the various funds, we should first make sure that this money cannot be used better and more efficiently in another way.

name: Milan ZVER
text: in writing.- I supported the report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, which estimates that Sweden is eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 1,793,710 under the terms of the EGF Regulation.Union financial assistance is intended for redundant workers with a lower level of education in order to facilitate their reintegration into the labor market and employment.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to balance the markets in the face of imbalances due to an increase in international trade.The Novakov report concerns the request for mobilization of an amount of € 380 000 from the Fund to cover technical assistance at the initiative of the Commission.We believe that this should be provided at no additional cost by the European Commission, leaving the full resources of this instrument in support of the companies and workers affected by the crisis and that the report also does not indicate with sufficient precision how these funds are directed.For these reasons I have decided to abstain.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written. - The Union has created legislative and budgetary instruments to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns or the global economic and financial crisis, as well as to help them re-enter the labor market, including the EGF. These funds are intended to mitigate the disastrous social consequences of the economic crisis of the capitalist system. Although these funds are not capable of solving the problems of the dismissed workers, at least they give the possibility of alleviating a small part of the human drama. In particular with this report, which I voted in favor, it is a question of approving the funding of the Expert Group on EGF Contact Persons and the seminars to promote contacts on the implementation of the EGF, so that this exchange also help to provide better and more detailed information on the success rate of EGF-supported measures in the Member States.

name: Louis ALIOT
text: in writing.- I voted against this text on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF).The report proposes here to release the sum of 380,000 euros to, among other things, finance the collection and monitoring of information by the Commission, the expansion of the EGF site managed by the Commission or the establishment of aadministrative and technical support.If these measures could encourage the request of the EGF to deal with redundancies, this is the exclusive competence of the Member States.Finally, this text tends to make people forget that these funds come from national taxpayers and not from the European Union.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. – We voted in favour of this report which was technical by nature but contained some very positive provisions, specifically in relation to releasing up much needed funds for the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing.- The provisions of this report, which are of relative importance, may be useful in encouraging the request for assistance from the EGF following redundancies.However, this competence must rest with the Member States only, and not give the illusion that it is the Union which grants aid when the funds come from national taxpayers.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ The principle of subsidiarity dictates that decisions should be taken at the closest possible level to the citizen – in this case, at regional or national level. Therefore, these projects should not be funded by the European Union. It is absurd that the arbiters of whether this funding should, or should not, be given are Members of the European Parliament with no detailed knowledge of the situation.  The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund should be scrapped, which would give money back to the Member States to decide for themselves about the appropriateness of such funding. Consequently, I had no option but to vote against – even though this may be a worthwhile project.

name: Jean ARTHUIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this deliberation, which provides for aid of 380,000 euros for the mobilization of the globalization adjustment fund, in order to help European public actors in the area of technical assistance.Nonetheless, I regret that the payment of this aid is made on the basis of layoffs when it could have been invaluable in helping the company to restructure.It is urgent to act and understand that our companies are the victims of the absence of the structural reforms necessary for their adaptation to the challenges of globalization.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this proposal, which aims to mobilize the EGF.It concerns the mobilization of a fund of EUR 380 000 to finance technical assistance at the initiative of the Commission.The purpose of technical assistance is to finance monitoring, information, interface with the knowledge base and advice to Member States on the use, monitoring and evaluation of the EGF.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against giving the unelected and unaccountable EU Commission an extra EUR 380 000 to help implement the globalisation adjustment fund. British taxpayers should not be forced to fund EU institutions to hand out our money for workers made redundant across Europe.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- I am opposed to this measure proposing a mobilization of 380,000 euros in favor of the Commission in order to develop the EGF (European Globalization Adjustment Fund, managed by the Commission) and to create a standard procedure for applications forGEF interventions, as well as administrative and technical support and state networking.These provisions, of minor importance, could perhaps prove useful in encouraging the request for assistance from the EGF following redundancies.However, this competence should rest with the Member States only, and it should not be given the illusion that it is the EU that provides aid when the funds come from national taxpayers.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- The legislation concerning the conditions applicable to financial contributions from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund indicates that an amount equivalent to at most 0.5% of the maximum annual amount remains available each year for the purposes of technical assistance onthe initiative of the Commission.I voted in favor of this mobilization of a sum of 380,000 euros because it will enable the Commission, in particular through administrative simplification, to make the application of the EGF regulation more efficient and faster, a necessary mechanism forcompensate for layoffs caused by global competition.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing.- Today I voted in favor of mobilizing the EGF to cover technical assistance, presented at the initiative of the Commission.The Novakov report foresees the allocation of € 380 000 to finance monitoring and information, to create a knowledge base and to advise Member States on the use, continuity and evaluation of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.In particular, the funds will be used to finance the activities of collecting and monitoring data relating to the applications received, the decisions taken and the measures implemented, as well as providing technical and administrative assistance to the various Member States.I am convinced that this mobilization of the EGF will help to create the conditions for the Fund itself to be used in the best way.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- We voted in favor of this report, as we consider it important and appropriate to mobilize part of the European Globalization Adjustment Funds for technical assistance, that is, in order to finance the preparation, monitoring, data collection andcreation of a knowledge base, technical and administrative support, information and communication activities, as well as the audit, control and evaluation activities necessary for the application of the EGF Regulation.Since the current use of this type of funds is not due to the type of investment in the affected areas that, from our point of view, can help to solve the problem, we consider that a good job of monitoring the impact of these funds could give thekeys to being able to offer other types of alternatives that provide sustainable solutions to these areas and people, and not only patch situations with compensation.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I have supported this report on the European Globalization Adjustment Fund regarding assistance to the Commission which refers to € 380,000 from the Fund to cover technical assistance from the Commission.This is intended to finance monitoring and information activities, the creation of a knowledge base / application interface and advice to Member States on the use, monitoring and evaluation of the fund.This contribution seems necessary to me.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing. - I voted against this Novakov report, which attempts to broaden the technical framework for managing the EGF. Of course, it could be useful to ensure better organization through a real collection and monitoring of information by the Commission, as well as to create a standard procedure for requests for assistance from the EGF. However, it should be remembered that these 380,000 euros requested to finance this simplification of the administrative management of requests for assistance from the EGF come from the pockets of national taxpayers. In this sense, this competence should fall to the Member States, better able to manage according to the principles of proportionality and subsidiarity. In addition, it is worth remembering that, if the States were left free to practice a real policy of economic patriotism, we would no longer need this instrument of adjustment which is only the admission of the devastating consequences of savage globalization.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- I supported the mobilization of the EGF for an amount of 380 000 euro for the technical assistance sector, in order to help improve the efficiency of the Globalization Adjustment Fund.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report to approve the mobilization of € 380,000 from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to provide technical assistance to the European Commission.This amount will be used to finance activities such as data collection, creation of a database, administrative and technical support, advice to Member States on the use, monitoring and evaluation of the EGF, communication activities, as well asaudit, control and evaluation.The activities financed should also contribute to the simplification of the EGF application procedure and its visibility and to improve the monitoring and evaluation of the effects of the EGF support on each of the participants.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF). According to the Commission proposal, in 2016 the amount requested should be used to finance the following activities: in particular, monitoring and data collection, i.e. y. The Commission will collect data on applications received, payments made and support provided, as well as on measures proposed and implemented. This data will be published on the website and collected in accordance with the requirements of the relevant format for submission in 2017. in a biennial report. Secondly, general awareness and visibility of the EGF will be raised. Third, the Commission is continuing its work to establish standard procedures for EGF application and administration. Fourth, administrative and technical support will be provided, i. The EGF Liaison Expert Group, composed of one member from each Member State, will hold two meetings (at the end of 2016 and in the first half of 2017). In addition, in order to promote networking between Member States, the Commission will organize two seminars involving the authorities responsible for implementing the EGF and the social partners. As far as possible, they will take place at approximately the same time as the expert group meetings; they will focus on issues related to the practical implementation of the EGF Regulation at local level.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing.- I believe that networking and the exchange of information on the EGF play an important role in the effective use of the EGF, and I therefore support the funding of an expert group of EGF liaison officers and networking seminars on the implementation of the EGF.I expect that this exchange of information will contribute to a better and more detailed analysis of the success rate of the measures financed by the EGF, and in particular the rate of re-employment of the beneficiaries, in the Member States.It is important not only to make sound decisions about the use of the fund, but also to monitor the effectiveness of their implementation.These evaluations could form the basis for assessing future applications to the EP.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this document because I believe it is important that, in order to ensure greater efficiency of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, it develops a system of technical assistance which allows the creation of networks and facilitates the exchange of information.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing.- Since the question in question is relevant to the legal and social areas relating to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), it is appropriate to proceed with the technical assistance of the companies involved, hoping for a rapid resumption of their productive activities and full employment protection.and the incomes of workers and their families.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing.- This report proposes to release the sum of 380,000 euros to finance the collection and monitoring of information by the Commission, the enlargement of the EGF site (European Globalization Adjustment Fund), the creation of a procedurestandardized for intervention requests or the establishment of administrative and technical support.Although these provisions may facilitate access to the EGF for workers made redundant, I spoke out against a report aimed at creating the illusion of a social and united Europe when these funds are supplied by contributions from the Member States.This is why I voted against this text on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF).

name: Daniel BUDA
text: signed up. - On 22 February 2016, the Commission adopted a new proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF. This proposal concerns the mobilization of an amount of EUR 380 000 from the EGF reserve for technical assistance at the initiative of the Commission. According to Article 11 (1) of the EGF Regulation, a proportion of 0,5% of the maximum annual amount of the EGF may be made available each year for technical assistance at the initiative of the Commission. In order to promote the relationship between the Member States, the Commission will organize two seminars with the participation of the EGF implementing bodies and the social partners. To the extent possible, they will be scheduled to take place around the same dates as the expert group meetings and will focus on issues arising from the practical implementation of the EGF Regulation at local level. I voted in favor of this report because the aim of the technical assistance is to fund monitoring, information, interface the knowledge base and to provide advice to Member States on the use, monitoring and evaluation of the EGF. . These are important because it will ensure better information to the general public about the EGF.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing.- € 380,000 from the Fund to cover technical assistance at the initiative of the Commission (maximum annual amount: € 828,060, i.e. 0.5% of the Fund's total), broken down as follows: € 20,000 for monitoring and data collection;20,000 euros for information;€ 100,000 for the creation of a knowledge base / interface;€ 70,000 for administrative and technical support;120,000 euros to promote networking;50,000 euros per evaluation.I vote in favor.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of this report to ensure that part of the annual budget of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) can be used for technical assistance from the EGF to finance preparation, monitoring, data collection and creation of a knowledge base, administrative and technical support and information and communication activities. I stress the importance of networking and exchanging information relating to the EGF. I therefore support the funding of the EGF Contact Persons Expert Group and the networking seminars on EGF implementation. I expect this exchange of information to help improve the success rate of EGF-supported measures in the Member States, in particular as regards the rate of achievement and re-employment of beneficiaries. I also think that all initiatives including enhanced participation and consultation of the local authorities who manage EGF support measures on a daily basis must be supported and strengthened.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report which was technical by nature but contained some very positive provisions, specifically in relation to releasing up much needed funds for the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against giving the unelected and unaccountable EU Commission an extra EUR 380 000 to help implement the globalisation adjustment fund. British taxpayers should not be forced to fund EU institutions to hand out our money for workers made redundant across Europe.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report and thereby gave my consent for the mobilisation of the Fund for technical assistance at the initiative of the European Commission. The amount granted to the Commission should improve the general functioning of this facility through improvement of monitoring and data gathering on applications received, creation of a knowledge base and more frequent consultations with the EGF implementing bodies and social partners.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
