text: Writing. \u2012 The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade. The proposal aims to use EUR 380 000 from the Fund for technical support to the Commission. I voted in favour.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. U2012 We voted in favour of this report, as we consider it important and appropriate to mobilize part of the European Globalisation Adjustment Funds for technical assistance, i.e. in order to finance the activities of preparation, monitoring, data collection and creation of a knowledge base, technical and administrative support, information and communication activities, as well as audit activities , control and evaluation necessary for the implementation of the EGF Regulation.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. I voted in favour of mobilizing the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund as this fund is a fundamental tool for alleviating the effects of industrial relocation processes.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. We are talking about a fund that is dedicated to processing transfers of funds to pay compensation for maximum redundancies for the cessation of different business activities of the Member States. Any action aimed at the proper functioning of this fund is welcome and necessary. That is why I consider it necessary to vote in favour of this decision.

name: Anneleen VAN BOSSUYT
text: Written. 'Globalisation is inevitable and goes hand in hand with the opening of new markets, with international competition, with economic growth and with job creation that exceeds job losses in less competitive sectors. As a result, structural reforms for sustainable economic growth are particularly needed. This requires economic tailor-made solutions combined with an adapted social policy for which, also in line with the Treaties, the Member States are the first and most appropriate government to be competent. The N-VA delegation in the European Parliament understands the objectives of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF), but is convinced that a European transfer union cannot be a remedy to tackle unemployment, nor can it replace a much-needed structural reform policy. The MEPs of the N-VA have therefore voted against this report.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an important tool to ensure that workers who lost their jobs as a result of rapid changes caused by globalisation reintegrate into the labour market as quickly and efficiently as possible. That is why I voted in favour of this provision.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 The Commission's proposal for this year, made on 22 February, has planned to mobilise EUR 380000 from the technical assistance fund (0.23% of the maximum available annual budget). The report contains some positive elements, such as the requirement to extend support to young people up to the age of 25 who do not work, study and do not train (NEETs), amending the EGF legal framework after 2017, and calls for more widespread use of the derogation to eligibility thresholds for SMEs and the extension of reference periods , as well as the possibility of including redundant workers providing services similar to those of workers made redundant by referral undertakings, cases with fewer than 500 employees, the minimum threshold for competing for the EGF. It calls for more data to be collected on the specific employability of the beneficiaries, including in the final reports the individual assessments of these beneficiaries. The Commission is also asked to provide a justification for the decision to subcontract an external auditor for the evaluation of the half-term of office.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. As this promotion is aimed at data collection, the financing of the preparation of technical and administrative assistance and the creation of a knowledge base, I voted in favour of the report.

name: Julie WARD
text: in writing. ‒ The Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an important tool that the EU deploys in order to support communities across Europe who are experiencing harmful economic shifts, in the form of business and factory closures or job losses, due to the flux of global trade and transactions. This can come in the form of re-training programmes or re-development, and opens the door for civil society and social enterprises, as well as local authorities to get involved in rebuilding their communities that would otherwise have been abandoned to dereliction. In the run-up to the UK referendum on EU membership, it is especially important to highlight to British voters this important source of funding, particularly relevant to my constituents in the North West of England. The Globalisation Adjustment Fund is one of the many enormous benefits of EU membership which we can potentially draw on and demonstrates the solidarity principle upon which the EU is founded.

name: Marco ZANNI
text: in writing. \u2012 We have today voted on the European Commission's annual request for technical assistance for the year 2016. The Novakov report concerns the request for mobilisation of EUR 380 000 from the Fund to cover technical assistance on the Commission's initiative. The objective of technical assistance is to finance monitoring and information, to create a knowledge/interface base and to advise Member States on the use, continuity and evaluation of the EGF.  I am generally in favour of mobilising this fund, although I am aware that this is probably not the instrument that best can help redundant workers, but in the absence of viable alternatives I nevertheless believe that it should be supported.  The issue of technical assistance is slightly different, because I believe that this should be provided at no extra cost by the European Commission, leaving all the resources of this instrument to support companies and workers affected by the crisis; The Novakov report stresses the need to make certain changes on this point, but without specifying precisely in which direction we should go. That is why I abstained.

name: Milan ZVER
text: Writing. \ i voted in favour of the legislative resolution providing that, within the general budget of the European Union for the financial year 2016, an amount of EUR 380 000 is to be used under the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund in commitment and payment appropriations for technical assistance aimed at financing monitoring, information, establishment of an interface for a knowledge base and advising Member States on the use, follow-up and evaluation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF).

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Commission has presented the draft amending budget to support the ongoing humanitarian emergency. We believe that emergency support operations are necessary at the moment, but there are concerns because this money is allocated with a transfer from the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund. That is why I have chosen to abstain.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. Although we share the need to adequately fund the different actors who are helping migrants and refugees in the European Union, this proposal comes back from a counterparty to strengthen Europe's Stronghold model. Under no circumstances can we share an increase in Europol's budget, particularly in the context of migration policy, as it would support closed detention centres and collective expulsions which are now the norm. That is why, and taking into account the urgency of the former, we have decided to abstain in this vote.

name: Louis ALIOT
text: In writing. I spoke out against this report on the draft amending budget. The aim of the text was to create a budgetary structure for the emergency aid instrument by redeploying EUR 100 million in commitment appropriations and EUR 80.2 million in payment credits for EU countries facing the migrant crisis. The reinforcement of Europol's staff, through the creation of 25 additional posts (2 million euros in commitment credits), is also proposed here. It should be remembered, however, that these instruments, which are going to be very expensive and inefficient, represent above all a real call for air to immigration. Further, we strongly condemn the fact that the Europol body has underestimated the reality of migration flows, namely the infiltration into these networks by IS fighters. I therefore objected to this text.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. This report includes two main elements: - the creation of a budgetary structure to provide faster aid to EU countries facing migrant crises; - strengthening staff at Europol's European Counter-Terrorism Centre to provide assistance to Member States. The creation of an additional 25 positions requires 2 million euros in commitment and payment credits.  These instruments will prove to be perfectly ineffective, costly and even harmful in creating a huge air call for future migrants. The only effective migration policy is the re-establishment of national borders to allow states to freely decide on their migration policy, as well as the systematic return of migrants and the creation of refugee centres in countries bordering war zones.  As for the fight against terrorism, it cannot be entrusted to a body (Europol) which has underestimated the fact that the Islamic State could use migratory flows to infiltrate terrorists and which promotes the total dismantling of national borders.  So I voted against

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ I do not approve of the principle of this instrument, and therefore voted against the Draft Amending Budget.

name: Jean ARTHUIS
text: In writing. The massive influx of refugees and migrants into Europe has created an exceptional situation in which large numbers of people are in need of emergency humanitarian assistance, exceeding the organisational capacity of one or more Member States. In addition, it has been necessary for the Union to substantially increase Europol's staff in response to the refugee crisis and to enable the operation of the newly created European Counter-Terrorism Centre. Affected by the refugee crisis and the terrorist threat, Europe must respond by pooling its resources and information. For all these reasons, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted on this proposal, which aims to support the amendments to the 2016 EU budget, which amount to EUR 100 million. Humanitarian aid to refugees sheltered in EU countries. In addition, the amendments mentioned above propose to also strengthen the European Counter-Terrorism Centre and allocate EUR 2 million to the European Counter-Terrorism Centre. new jobs.  In view of the massive influx of refugees and migrants into Europe and the exceptional humanitarian situation in some EU countries, on 2 March 2016, the European Commission proposed the creation of a eur 700 million target for the development of a european economy. emergency support fund. EUR 100 million | Humanitarian aid would become the first stream of support for this fund and help refugees provide food, health, housing, water, sanitation, hygiene and education services

name: Zoltán BALCZÓ
text: Writing. \u2012 The report is about the creation of a new instrument for the provision of emergency assistance within the Union for the Financial Year 2016. According to the report, the exceptional situation created by the mass influx of refugees and migrants into Europe exceeds the capacity of the member states most affected to respond, and at the same time there is no adequate instrument at EU level to deal with the situation within the Union.  Among other things, there is a need to strengthen the staff of the European Centre for combating terrorism within Europol, given the current security situation in the European Union.  The Council has submitted a draft araking of a budget to create a budgetary structure for the instrument concerned through redeployment within Chapter 3 of the MED. The redeployment provides for a commitment appropriation of EUR 100 million and a payment appropriation of EUR 80.2 million for the new instrument to meet immediate financing needs.  The source of the money may still be debated in support of the report. It seems appropriate not to implement the new instrument at the expense of the flexibility framework, but to realrare it from less important places. This suggestion should also be supported because the flexibility instrument is not a permanent task but is in order to finance extraordinary cases, but immigration will, unfortunately, not be an extraordinary situation, but a lasting situation.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against approving an extra EUR 100 million for the EU’s migration policy and EUR 2 million for extra staff at Europol. The EU has helped to create the refugee crisis by encouraging millions of people to come to Europe and make the dangerous journey across the Mediterranean. The EU has no right to make British taxpayers pay for its own failures. Countries should work together on a bilateral basis to solve the refugee crisis and fight terrorism, but not through unelected and unaccountable EU institutions.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. This report, which presents a correction of the budget for 2016 in order to provide emergency aid within the Union, proposes the creation of a budgetary structure for the emergency aid instrument to provide faster aid to EU countries facing migrant crises through the redeployment of funds, as well as the reinforcement of staff from the European Counter-Terrorism Centre. I am opposed to these costly and ineffective measures, in that they refuse to tackle the real problems involved in the migration phenomenon, as well as to let the Member States decide, in full sovereignty, their migration policy. In addition, Europol has shown its ineffectiveness in combating the perpetrators of the Paris attacks, unlike the national intelligence services. I will not endorse an unconscious migration and security policy.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. This adjustment of the draft budget for the 2016 financial year aims to provide emergency assistance within the Union in the area of migration and home affairs policy and to strengthen the staffing of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within EUROPOL without having a net impact on the level of appropriations in the 2016 budget.  I voted in favour of this budgetary adjustment project, partly because it is european solidarity to financially support the Member States that are bearing the migration crisis and on the other because it is essential to strengthen the exchange of information between Member States in the prevention of further terrorist attacks on the territory of the European Union.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. \u2012 The migration crisis has put and continues to put a strain on the responses that Europe is able to provide, both in terms of humanitarian support and in terms of policies, to address the economic and social difficulties that are developing at its borders and within it. The European Commission has decided to create a new Eu ropean budget line to rapidly finance those aid measures which the Member States have decided to implement in order to deal with humanitarian emergency situations.  I voted in favour of the Fernandes report because I believe that this Commission decision should be strongly supported. Since the beginning of the crisis, the European Parliament has mobilised to demand rapid responses and to launch a draft amendment to the existing legislation, in order to make the Union capable of reacting to the new, profound and sudden changes. The adoption of the amending budget is further proof of this will.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: in writing. We are refraining from supporting this report, since while we support the urgent sending of funds to assist in humanitarian aid for refugees, we do not see with good eyes that the same report mixes items for humanitarian aid with items for police, border and counter-terrorism control. This is a humanitarian crisis, and in Podemos we openly disagree with the measures being taken by the EU, outsourcing to other countries of border control and the creation of 'stopging states', together with hot returns, without following the legislation itself on petitions for political asylum, and the rise of xenophobic prospects and immobility of states in the face of this refugee crisis , leads us to refrain from supporting the deviating of these funds in this way in order to make up the EU's position.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. I objected to this report on the draft amending budget on the new instrument to provide emergency aid within the Union. The rapporteur tends to forget that the need for such aid stems from the European Union's catastrophic choices on migration policy. When the doors open wide, it is rather tendentious to make the States undergoing this submersion believe that they will benefit from the redeployment of 100 million euros in commitment credits and 80.2 million in payment credits: let us not forget that these funds come from the Member States themselves! Furthermore, the strengthening of Europol's European counter-terrorism centre, including the creation of 25 additional posts, which will cost EUR 2 million in commitment and payment credits, will once again prove the EU's ineffectiveness in the fight against terrorism, as the Europol agency has, by sheer ideology, deliberately ignored the fact that terrorists can infiltrate via migration flows. A plan to rectify the budget, which will therefore prove both costly and unnecessary, only the restoration of national borders and the sovereignty of Member States that can help to put an end to the migration crisis and an effective fight against terrorism.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The report as a whole is acceptable and balanced. I therefore voted in favour of approving the new instrument to strengthen the staff of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre.

name: Malin BJÖRK
text: Written. I have voted in favour of the report. This report increases the EU budget for refugees by EUR 100 million. There is a great need to improve the EU's refugee work, from relocation, reception and integration. EUR 2 million will go to Europol and efforts to combat terrorism. The Left Party does not want to increase Europol's budget. There is already a great deal of cooperation between Member States, and bilateral cooperation between member states' national police forces could be stepped up instead of a super-EU police force. The most important thing, however, is that the situation of refugees is significantly improved. That is why I voted in favour of the report.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. The proposed budget changes have two main objectives. On the one hand, enable emergency aid funds to address humanitarian needs arising from the refugee crisis: in particular, EUR 100 million in commitment appropriations and EUR 80.2 million in payment appropriations for the most immediate financing needs. On the other hand, funds are enabled to strengthen the staff of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre in Europol, namely 25 additional staff positions, 5 contract agents and 5 national experts. For all this, I voted in favour.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report, in which the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs (LIBE) welcomes the Commission's proposal to create an EU budget line that would finance urgent support in the European Union more quickly and appropriately by broadening the range of financial instruments already available to date in order to respond to emergencies in the EU.  However, the LIBE Committee was not persuaded by the decision proposed by the European Commission to immediately establish a new emergency humanitarian mechanism. It seems completely inappropriate not to include one of the two co-legislators in the legislative process in the case of the creation of a new fund to provide humanitarian aid in the Union. The LIBE Committee deplores the fact that the urgency situation is due to a lack of a coherent strategy and vision to find a solution to the migration crisis at European level, and insists that the EU should not make continuous use of budgetary procedures, such as the Flexibility Instrument, to finance the Union's migration policy. However, the LIBE Committee welcomes the fact that the new instrument will enable the Union to take action in a spirit of solidarity and to meet the basic needs of people in distress within the Territory of the Union. Indeed, the situation of migrants and asylum seekers is deteriorating, especially in Greece, which is in a very difficult economic situation and therefore needs to take a joint initiative at European level. The LIBE Committee hopes that the new measure will minimise the economic impact in affected Member States where an emergency is occurring or will occur in relation to the migration crisis, in particular in greece's neighbouring countries.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: Writing. \u2012 The report proposes to adopt without change the Commission's proposal, which has two main elements: the creation of a budgetary structure for a new fund to support emergencies within the EU by reallocing EUR 100 million in commitments and EUR 80.2 million in payments within Budget Chapter 3 and strengthening the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within EUROPOL. In view of the fact that draft araking 1/2016 is in line with the financial annex to the regulation on humanitarian aid adopted within the Union and that the resources to be mobilised will be allocated from Chapter 3, I voted in favour of the adoption of this report.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: Writing. Last week, in plenary within the EPP Group, MEPs supported the report on the draft amending of the European Union budget for the provision of emergency assistance in the Union. At a time when the European Union is facing a state of emergency with massive influxes of refugees and migrants, many people need urgent humanitarian assistance. Since the capacity of most Member States to respond to this emergency has already been exhausted, It seems to me that we have taken the right decision with this measure.

name: Marie-Christine BOUTONNET
text: In writing. The draft amending budget is a new instrument to provide emergency aid within the European Union. The text of the Fernandes report aims to create emergency aid of 100,000 euros for refugees. On the other hand, it is strengthening the number of Europol, the European counter-terrorism centre, which wants a total dismantling of borders and has downplayed the possibility for the Islamic State to use migrant flows to infiltrate terrorists. I, of course, voted against this report.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this document because I believe it is important for the European Union to give substantial support to the efforts of those Member States that have been involved in the very serious migration crisis that has been affecting the EU in recent months.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing. \u2012 The obvious need to build a real European police office, accompanied by a desire for defence and relationship with the common foreign countries, can only be reiterated in every possible forum: it is no longer the time for national self-interest to perch, but to make the institutional leap that European citizens are asking us to make in response to the challenges that the complex geopolitical scenario presents us with. Unity, cohesion and solidarity are the fundamental pillars for any successful organisation: it is up to us Europeans to return to practising them every day.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. This report aims to create a budgetary structure for the emergency aid instrument to provide more rapid financial assistance to EU Member States facing the current migration crisis, including the redeployment of EUR 100 million in commitment appropriations and EUR 80.2 million in payment credits.  The rapporteur also advocates strengthening Europol's staff, through the creation of 25 posts requiring an additional EUR 2 million in commitment appropriations. It should be remembered, however, that these instruments, which are very expensive and inefficient, are likely to create a call for air to immigration. Finally, it is absolutely absurd that the fight against terrorism should be entrusted to Europol, since this body which promotes the total dismantling of national borders has underestimated the Islamic State in its ability to use migratory flows to infiltrate terrorists.  That is why I voted against this report.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report on draft amending budget No. 1/2016: a new instrument for providing emergency support across the Union. Urgent humanitarian assistance is needed due to the massive influx of refugees and migrants to Europe, where an exceptional situation has been created, because a large number of people need aid, which exceeds the organisational capacity of one or more Member States. The Commission proposes the creation of an instrument that will enable the Union to provide financial support, for example through partner organisations, which are able to quickly implement urgent actions in support of those Member States that are most affected. Through this draft amending budget, the Commission proposes to make available a first tranche of EUR 100 million of commitment appropriations to cover the immediate financing needs of the instrument. The Commission will use transitional measures to respond to immediate needs until the entry into force of the new instrument and the proposed amending budget.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 PBR No 1/2016 is used to finance the new instrument for the provision of emergency support within the Union. The first appropriation consists of 100 million in commitments and 80.2 million in payments; the Commission expects a total requirement of 300 million for 2016 and 200 million per year for 2017 and 2018. Now, if we read in Art. 1 of the Reg. 2016/369, the instrument is activated "in case of natural or man-made disasters ... only if the disaster has an exceptional dimension and impact such as to have serious and far-reaching humanitarian consequences in one or more Member States." Everything would suggest that these are floods, earthquakes, fires and the like. Instead, when we read the recitals, we find that mass immigration is equated with a 'catastrophe', the impact of which is the EU as a result of 'circumstances occurring in the EU's neighbourhood'. The positive note of this masterpiece of ambiguity is that this is not fresh money, but a transfer from the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF), which corresponds to about 10 % of the billion devoted to the redistribution of 160 000 immigrants in the period 2015-17.Considering the small sum and the purpose, I voted in favour.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of this report to allow the EU budget to provide emergency aid on EU territory to respond to the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. The situation of migrants and asylum seekers is deteriorating, in particular because of the un coordinated response of European countries, which makes this emergency aid even more necessary and urgent. I stress the need to show solidarity with those Member States that are facing such an emergency situation on their territory. I believe that a more sustainable legal and budgetary framework should be provided so that humanitarian aid can be mobilised in the future within the EU, when circumstances so require.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against approving an extra EUR 100 million for the EU’s migration policy and EUR 2 million for extra staff at Europol. The EU has helped to create the refugee crisis by encouraging millions of people to come to Europe and make the dangerous journey across the Mediterranean. The EU has no right to make British taxpayers pay for its own failures. Countries should work together on a bilateral basis to solve the refugee crisis and fight terrorism, but not through unelected and unaccountable EU institutions.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome the proposal of the European Commission to provide additional financial support to the regions particularly affected by the current refugee crisis. Those regions should not be left to cope with the crisis alone and in the spirit of solidarity the European Union should try to provide some financial relief in situations where it is able to so do. I therefore voted in favour of this report.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 I am in favour of creating this new tool, in the hope that it can really be of some use to the management of this emergency that has been going on for many months now. With the budget presented, EUR 100 million is made available in commitments and EUR 80.2 million in payments for immediate financial needs, so I am very perplexed that they come from the budget line concerning the asylum, migration and integration fund, which is a top priority. I preferred to abstain.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: Writing. \u2012 We support the report bearing in mind that the massive influx of refugees and migrants into Europe has created an emergency situation where large numbers of people need urgent humanitarian assistance within the Union, a situation which has seriously tested the response capacity of the Member States most affected.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 With my vote in favour of this report, I wanted to allow the EU budget to provide emergency aid on EU territory to respond to the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. In my opinion, it is essential to shift resources in such a way as to respond effectively to the situation of migrants and asylum seekers, which is becoming increasingly difficult and where immediate help is increasingly needed. We must show solidarity with the Member States facing such an emergency situation on their territory, and that is precisely why I voted in favour, because I believe that one of these countries that needs effective cooperation in this area is Italy. In addition, this report also aims to increase the staff of Europol's European Counter-Terrorism Centre and was one more reason to vote in favour. In the light of the current situation, I think it is necessary to invest more resources, especially when it is clear that the work in this respect is not enough. More is needed and Europe, in my view, all the means necessary to make up for these shortcomings.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ It is important and welcome to see staffing increase for Europol’s European Counter-Terrorism Centre considering the current security situation in the European Union.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. \u2012 The strong influx of people to the Union's external borders has forced emergency responses. The same is also the case for the security issues which, in 2015 and already in 2016, have forced a strengthening of resources. This first amending budget of 2016 operates in these two dimensions. In terms of security, the reinforcement of staff at Europol in about 30 people is particularly important. At the level of the so-called "refugee crisis", the new internal humanitarian emergency fund.  The need and urgency of this new fund is indisputable, but once again we have used an ad hoc instrument, which has avoided the normal legislative process (where the European Parliament is a co-legislator). However, as has become clear from this budget which finances it in response to the refugee crisis, Parliament has always been constructive and fast. The lack of vision and, too often, the lack of cooperation and a sense of urgency has come from the Member States. It should also be stressed the pressure on the Asylum and Migration Fund (AMIF), the source of funding here too and which therefore needs to be further revised and strengthened.

name: Birgit COLLIN-LANGEN
text: Writing. I support the report because it will enable us to provide immediate funds for food, emergency medical care, shelter, water and sanitation, and hygiene, protection and education. However, we must not forget that we still do not have an overall strategy for dealing with the refugee crisis. And this overall strategy is necessary if we are to have a legal framework in the future on the basis of which humanitarian aid can be provided within the Union, in line with the budget.

name: Jane COLLINS
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against approving an extra EUR 100 million for the EU’s migration policy and EUR 2 million for extra staff at Europol. The EU has helped to create the refugee crisis by encouraging millions of people to come to Europe and make the dangerous journey across the Mediterranean. The EU has no right to make British taxpayers pay for its own failures. Countries should work together on a bilateral basis to solve the refugee crisis and fight terrorism, but not through unelected and unaccountable EU institutions.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 The report on draft amending budget (PBR) No 1 for 2016 deals with the new instrument providing emergency assistance within Member States, in order to respond to the humanitarian needs caused by the current migration emergency. The humanitarian emergency that we are experiencing in recent years must include assistance, rescue and protection operations to protect the lives and integrity of people in emergency and post-emergency conditions. EU funding should support emergency support operations, such as the construction of housing or shelters for groups of people concerned. The budget presented provides 100 million in commitments and 80.2 million in payments for immediate financial needs. I am in favour of creating an instrument for providing emergency support within the EU, so that we can manage the humanitarian emergency in which we have been involved for several years now. However, I believe it is necessary to understand where these funds come from and to ensure that they are not part of the AMIF (asylum, migration and integration) fund, but are found from other budget lines. That is why I am abstaining.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. Although we share the need to adequately fund the different actors who are helping migrants and refugees in the European Union, this proposal comes back from a counterparty to strengthen Europe's Stronghold model. Under no circumstances can we share an increase in Europol's budget, particularly in the context of migration policy, as it would support closed detention centres and collective expulsions which are now the norm. That is why, and taking into account the urgency of the former, we have decided to abstain in this vote.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: in writing. \u2012 Parliament has always reacted promptly to initiatives presented in the context of the refugee crisis. The massive influx of refugees into Europe has created an exceptional situation where, at the moment, around 55,000 refugees are stranded on the territory of Greece, a country with a difficult economic situation. I voted for the implementation of this new instrument which will enable the Union to meet the needs of those affected by this exceptional situation.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 Draft amending budget No 1/2016 consists of two parts. The first concerns the transfer of funds to a new instrument to provide emergency support within the EU. The second part concerns the transfer to the European Counter-Terrorism Centre (ECTC). In early March, the Commission adopted a new instrument for emergency support and humanitarian aid within the EU, in particular to help Member States facing the immigration and refugee crisis. The Commission's Humanitarian Unit will be responsible for managing the new instrument, which will be implemented by partner organisations such as UN agencies and NGOs. The project also includes a €2 million transfer from the Internal Security Fund to strengthen the ECTC, which is to be the main counter-terrorism centre in the EU. Given the obvious need for emergency support and provision within the EU, as well as the strengthening of the ECTC in the fight against the growing terrorist threat, I supported it in the vote.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This draft amending budget for the 2016 financial year aims to create the necessary budget structure for the proposed new instrument to provide emergency aid within the Union.  It also aims to strengthen the staff of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within Europol, to enable the agency to play a central role in the fight against terrorism within the Union.  The project provides 100 million euros for humanitarian aid, and 2 million euros to strengthen the staff of Europol, which is expected to become the main counter-terrorism centre at European level.  Considering that the current security situation requires additional safeguards, I supported this draft amending budget.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which provides for a new instrument to provide emergency aid within the European Union. Following the latest terrorist attacks, it is essential that the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within Europol is fully operational and has the necessary manpower to effectively combat terrorism.

name: Andor DELI
text: Writing. \u2012 The report proposes to adopt without change the Commission's proposal, which has two main elements: the creation of a budgetary structure for a new fund to support emergencies within the EU by reallocing EUR 100 million in commitments and EUR 80.2 million in payments within Budget Chapter 3 and strengthening the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within EUROPOL. In view of the fact that draft araking 1/2016 is in line with the financial annex to the regulation on humanitarian aid adopted within the Union and that the resources to be mobilised will be allocated from Chapter 3, I voted in favour of the adoption of this report.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. The text aims to provide faster aid to EU countries facing the migrant crisis. The management of the emergency aid instrument would be entrusted to the European Commission's Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection Service (ECHO). However, the needs are estimated at several hundred million euros per year.  In addition, the reinforcement of staff at Europol's European Counter-Terrorism Centre requires EUR 2 million in commitment and payment credits. However, the fight against terrorism cannot be entrusted to a body (Europol) which has underestimated the infiltration of migratory flows by terrorists.  Because states must freely decide their migration policy and taxpayers should not be asked to finance mass immigration, I voted against this text.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: in writing. \u2012 There are two components in draft amending budget (DAB) No 1/2016. The first part concerns the development of a new instrument for providing emergency assistance within the EU. The second part contains a transfer of finances to the European Counter-Terrorism Centre.  In my opinion, a comprehensive strategy is needed to tackle the immigrant crisis, not a piecemeal, as the European Commission and the Council are currently acting on. However, I supported the amending budget, which will support the most affected countries, such as Bulgaria, which is also an external border of the EU. It will also help fight illegal immigration and fight terrorism.   I hope that in the future the institutions of the European Union will create a clear and coherent strategy for the protection of our borders, as well as for the return of persons who are within the EU in search of social benefits.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: Writing. \u2012 The report proposes to adopt without change the Commission's proposal, which has two main elements: the creation of a budgetary structure for a new fund to support emergencies within the EU by reallocing EUR 100 million in commitments and EUR 80.2 million in payments within Budget Chapter 3 and strengthening the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within EUROPOL. In view of the fact that draft araking 1/2016 is in line with the financial annex to the regulation on humanitarian aid adopted within the Union and that the resources to be mobilised will be allocated from Chapter 3, I voted in favour of the adoption of this report.

name: Jill EVANS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report on the budget. It is important as it creates an emergency support mechanism to address humanitarian crises within the EU, and also to fund extra staff for the Counter-Terrorism unit at EUROPOL. The effective functioning of the EU on these issues is important for my constituents in Wales.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 This amending budget proposes the amount of EUR 100 million for the creation of an instrument for the provision of emergency support in the Union.  The urgency at the moment is the situation of refugees in Greece. There is a humanitarian emergency that involves urgent action, and Greece cannot be able to cope alone. But this urgency was predictable! The EU continues to react. This €700 million instrument (€300 million in 2016, now 100 with a transfer from the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund, 200 million in 2017 and 200 million in 2018) should not be limited to 3 years. It should be a fund, based on a regulation, which would be triggered whenever a humanitarian emergency occurred within the EU. Its funding should be additional and extraordinary, as with the natural disasters fund and the solidarity fund. In this amending budget, there is also a strengthening of staff for the European Counter-Terrorism Centre at Europol, amounting to EUR 2 million. Combating terrorism requires shared, coordinated and concerted action at EU level.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. Vote against: instruments that will prove perfectly ineffective, costly and even harmful by creating a huge air call for future migrants.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 It is proposed to create a budget line to finance emergency support more quickly and more specifically within the EU, and until now there was only one line to support external emergencies. The range of financial instruments available to deal with emergencies is therefore widened. However, there are doubts about the new emergency humanitarian assistance mechanism — doubts as to how the associated funds will be used and for what ultimate purpose, which the European Parliament's Own Committee on Freedoms has raised. Of course, this urgency arises from the lack of a coherent strategy and vision to find a solution to the migration crisis at European level. This draft budget does not provide for new funds, as 100 million will be transferred from the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund to this new Emergency Fund. Furthermore, the resources of Europol and the European Counter-Terrorism Centre are strengthened, in a context where the EU insists on policies of aggression and interference that are inseparable from the phenomenon of terrorism, while using it as a pretext to justify a security drift that guarantees rights, freedoms and guarantees.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The current migration situation and the recent terrorist events in Brussels require a prompt, clear and decisive response from the Eu ropean Union, which is why I voted in favour of Mr Fernandes' report. The sense of responsibility leads us to approve this draft budget amendment in order to provide the first aid to the thousands of migrants who press at the EU's borders every day and to strengthen the level of staff of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre, in the hope that it will not only be a measure to be taken into account quantitatively, but that it will represent a qualitative leap in the fight against the terrorist threat. There are certainly some critical issues, such as the use of new ad hoc instruments despite existing ones or the lack of information and transparency on the remaining funds needed for 2016, but I reiterate the need and urgency for the EU, in cooperation with the Member States, to take swift and concrete action.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 The influx of refugees and migrants into Europe has created an exceptional situation in which large numbers of people require urgent humanitarian assistance. The European Commission has responded to this situation by presenting an amending budget aimed at establishing a budgetary structure and making AVAILABLE EUR 100 million in commitment appropriations and EUR 80.2 million in payment appropriations for immediate financing needs through a transfer under Heading 3 of the Multiannual Financial Framework. I welcome this proposal from the European Commission in question, because it is essential that we release more funds to deal with the consequences of migratory pressures on Europe. A more sustainable legal and budgetary framework should therefore be established in the future in order to allow the mobilisation of humanitarian aid within the European Union.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the report as it provides for the strengthening of the counter-terrorism centre.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. \u2012 The management of the refugee crisis as well as the fight against terrorism is mis-implemented by the institutions, because the European citizen and his security are not prioritised.  They turn a blind light to the huge influx of illegal immigrants, jihadists and criminal Islamic extremists who are exploiting refugee inflows to enter Europe. Tackling illegal immigration and terrorism is not achieved by setting up funds, which are more a means of manipulating public opinion than solving the problem. The problem is not economic, but social, religious, ethnic, and much more European. For all the above reasons, I am voting against draft amending budget No 1/2004. 1/2016.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome the proposal by the Commission to enable the Union budget to provide emergency support within the Union territory in order to tackle the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. A more sustainable legal and budgetary framework should be envisaged in order to allow for humanitarian aid within the Union to be mobilised in the future, when circumstances so require; such emergency funding, meant at responding to crises and unforeseen situations, should by its very nature be covered by special instruments and be counted outside the MFF ceilings.

name: Kinga GÁL
text: Writing. \u2012 The report proposes to adopt without change the Commission's proposal, which has two main elements: the creation of a budgetary structure for a new fund to support emergencies within the EU by reallocing EUR 100 million in commitments and EUR 80.2 million in payments within Budget Chapter 3 and strengthening the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within EUROPOL. In view of the fact that draft araking 1/2016 is in line with the financial annex to the regulation on humanitarian aid adopted within the Union and that the resources to be mobilised will be allocated from Chapter 3, I voted in favour of the adoption of this report.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 The mass influx of migrants into Europe has created an emergency situation to avoid a humanitarian catastrophe and to reduce the burden on Member States within the Union by creating an emergency support fund. The Commission's proposal allows emergency assistance from the EU budget to be provided within the Union in order to address the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. The creation of the new instrument amends the draft araking of the budget for the EU financial year 2016.  I voted in favour of Mr Jose Manuel Fernandes's report, but it is not always the 'uncoordinated response' of the burden-hit frontline countries that is causing the situation of asylum seekers to deteriorate, the report states.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the report with the firm will to contribute to improving the living conditions of refugees from Syria. In the face of the current problem, new funding models are needed to be able to provide adequate, rapid and effective assistance to this group so punished by violence and war. The European institutions, as well as the Member States, must keep in mind that the humanitarian crisis we are facing will not go away until we are able to help restore peace and security in Syria. We must therefore have the necessary mechanisms and budget to provide assistance to people fleeing war.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted today in favour of the report on new instruments for the provision of emergency aid within the Union. The refugee situation in Europe – with a focus on Germany, among others – has shown us how important such financial instruments are. The new funding pot will allow emergency aid to be provided within the territory of the Union to deal with the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. I welcome this and hope that the Member States, regions and local authorities will make use of it.

name: Lidia Joanna GERINGER DE OEDENBERG
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The draft amending budget for 2016 is dedicated to creating a budgetary structure for the proposed new instrument to provide emergency support within the Union and to make available EUR 100 million for emergency financial needs.  There are more than 1.8 million illegal immigrants crossing EU borders, but the European agency Frontex estimates that this figure is much higher because many people have not been registered. This is an exceptional situation in which a significant number of people need immediate humanitarian assistance that goes beyond the organisational capacity of individual Member States.  I welcome the European Commission's proposal that funds for the new financial instrument be transferred from the resources currently allocated to the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF). The proposed amount to be rede shifted from the AMIF takes into account both the immediate financial needs of the new instrument and the foreseeable need for AMIF funds in the coming months. In addition, the Commission will closely monitor the implementation of the 2016 budget in order to propose an amending budget at any time in order to provide the necessary financial resources for both the AMIF and the Emergency Support Instrument. This will take into account the changing needs during the year.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I support the proposal for a new instrument for emergency aid within the Union in view of the precarious humanitarian situation of the arriving refugees. I also think it is important to have such an instrument available as a buffer for future disaster victims.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this draft amendment. It will help create a budget structure for the proposed new instrument enabling us to use current EU budget funds for humanitarian aid within the EU. In addition, it was reinforce the staffing levels of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre in EUROPOL. This is particularly pertinent given the recent attacks in Brussels.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: In writing. The purpose of this report is to provide additional resources to countries facing the massive influx of migrants. More than 100 million euros will be allocated for humanitarian aid (100 million) and for the fight against terrorism (2 million).  While it is now common knowledge that Islamic State armies are exploiting the flow of migrants to enter and carry out attacks in our countries, it is irresponsible and criminal to provide the means to continue to take in migrants.  Not only are these amounts largely insufficient, but the Union also refuses to take the only real step to stem this crisis: closing our borders as Australia has done.  I obviously voted against this report.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We are refraining from supporting this report, since while we support the urgent sending of funds to assist in humanitarian aid for refugees, we do not see with good eyes that the same report mixes items for humanitarian aid with items for police, border and counter-terrorism control. This is a humanitarian crisis, and in Podemos we openly disagree with the measures being taken by the EU, outsourcing to other countries of border control and the creation of 'stopging states', together with hot returns, without following the legislation itself on petitions for political asylum, and the rise of xenophobic prospects and immobility of states in the face of this refugee crisis , leads us to refrain from supporting the deviating of these funds in this way in order to make up the EU's position.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: Writing. \u2012 We have abstained on this report, always stressing that our perception of dealing with refugees must be our solidarity and commitment to humanitarian values. We stand critically against the policing and isolation of Member States or the marginalisation of groups of the population.  The Commission has proposed to increase europol's staffing level at the same time as funds are cut off from the Humanitarian Aid and Social Protection Fund. We did not vote against the report because part of the funds will be given to Greece in support of the refugee issue.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this amendment as it allows for a quicker response to humanitarian disasters from the EU by implementing a new financing instrument.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ The Commission estimates that this new instrument should provide emergency support within the Union of approximate 300 million EUR in 2016, 200 million EUR in 2017 and 200 million EUR in 2018. Also, additional need could appear if migrant’s flows continue to increase. I have voted for this report that brings a more sustainable budgetary and legislative framework that would allow humanitarian aid within the EU in the future.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the Council Position Report on draft budget amendment No 2012. 1/2016 of the European Union for the financial year 2016 - A new instrument to provide emergency support within the Union, as the huge influx of refugees and migrants to Europe has created an emergency situation, and existing instruments need to be complemented to meet humanitarian needs within the Union.  The Commission estimates that €300 million will have to be allocated for this purpose in 2016, followed by €200 million in 2017 and 2018, according to forecasts of the future influx of migrants and refugees. In addition, europol's european counter-terrorism centre needs to be increased in view of the current security situation in the European Union, which requires additional resources.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. This report aims to establish instruments that are supposed to provide emergency aid within the Union. They will prove to be completely ineffective, costly and even harmful by creating a huge air call for future migrants.  The only effective migration policy is the re-establishment of national borders to allow states to freely decide on their migration policy, as well as the systematic return of migrants and the creation of refugee centres in countries bordering war zones.  As for the fight against terrorism, it cannot be entrusted to a body (Europol) which has underestimated the fact that the Islamic State could use migratory flows to infiltrate terrorists and which promotes the total dismantling of national borders.  I voted against it.

name: Diane JAMES
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against approving an extra EUR 100 million for the EU’s migration policy and EUR 2 million for extra staff at Europol. The EU has helped to create the refugee crisis by encouraging millions of people to come to Europe and make the dangerous journey across the Mediterranean. The EU has no right to make British taxpayers pay for its own failures. Countries should work together on a bilateral basis to solve the refugee crisis and fight terrorism, but not through unelected and unaccountable EU institutions.

name: Petr JEŽEK
text: in writing. ‒ I support the transfer of funds to offer emergency support to tackle the humanitarian consequences of the migration crisis. In my view this is a much better use of the money than funding the failed relocation scheme. The humanitarian needs on the borders of the EU are high, and I feel it is necessary to give support to countries dealing with the large influx of refugees. I agree that the EU will need to have a longer term approach in terms of budgetary planning for the coming years. As long as the war rages on in Syria, refugees will continue to make the journey to Europe. We need to be prepared and equipped for this.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague José Manuel Fernandes' report on the draft amending budget to provide emergency aid within the Union.  The aim is to create a new chapter and two budget lines, which will be fed to the tune of 300 million euros in 2016, 200 million in 2017 and 200 million in 2018 to support the Member States most affected by the migration crisis.  I have spoken in favour of this amending budget in order to reaffirm the Union's support for the countries on the front line of the refugee crisis affecting Europe.  This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on the EU's draft amending budget No. 1/2016 to provide emergency aid within the EU to relieve countries, such as Greece, which are experiencing a massive influx of refugees and migrants. This will provide EUR 100 million for emergency aid to refugees in the EU and EUR 2 million to strengthen the staff of Europol's European Counter-Terrorism Centre (ECTC).

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. As there are already several funds for asylum, migration and integration, I do not see any need to provide an estimated amount of more than EUR 10 million from EU funds until the funding instrument from the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF) is fully stocked.

name: Bernd KÖLMEL
text: Writing. The first amending budget of the current year is taking the right steps: the introduction of a new budget line for the provision of emergency aid within the Union will ensure budgetary authenticity. The figure provides planning certainty for the years 2016 to 2018 and allows emergency aid to be rapidly delivered from the Union budget in the territory of the Union to deal with the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. This solution is a good simplification of procedures. I welcome the fact that funds are to be made available for this purpose through a redeployment in the budget. I would like to see the same for the funds in 2017/2018. The staff of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre, which is based at Europol, will also be increased. This is in line with our call for more resources to increase security in Europe. That is why I voted in favour of the Fernandes report.

name: Béla KOVÁCS
text: Writing. \u2012 The report is correct in that the mass influx of refugees and migrants into Europe exceeds the capacity of the Member States most affected to respond, while at the same time there is no adequate instrument at EU level to deal with the situation. It is now clear that the EU has taken a poor line on the migrant issue, as evidenced by the attacks carried out, the perpetrators of which have returned to Europe as migrants, with combat experience and terrorist skills. In some way, it is necessary to finance the escape from the impediment, the resolution of the situation, or at least the management of the situation.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. With today's vote, we are allowing the EU budget to provide emergency aid on European territory, in order to be able to adequately manage humanitarian crises caused by large migratory flows. These events, which have now become constant, are no longer able to be endured by the Italian or Greek State, precisely because of the epochal dimensions assumed by the migration phenomenon and the resources activated so far by Europe have proved insufficient to manage a crisis of this magnitude. This is part of the European Parliament's proposal to make operational the amendment of the EU 2016 budget, which provides for EUR 700 million over three years. We must activate aid and internal coordination between states, also with a view to the relocation of migrants, which can no longer be postponed, as well as the strengthening of the staff of Europol's counter-terrorism centre, which is present on the territory with an important deployment of resources, which must be guaranteed maximum effectiveness and support. We cannot turn the other way, the whole of Europe and not just the border countries, is responsible for what is happening.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted against the report on the draft amending budget No. 1/2016 on a new instrument to provide emergency aid within the Union.  The text provides for the creation of a budgetary structure for the emergency aid instrument to provide faster aid to EU countries facing migrant crises through the redeployment of EUR 100 million in commitment credits and 80.2 in payment credits. However, the needs of this instrument are estimated by the ratio to 300 million euros in 2016, then 200 in 2017 and 2018 (voluntarily low range).  The report also foresees a strengthening of Europol. The creation of 25 additional positions requires 2 million euros.  Needless to say, these instruments will prove to be completely ineffective, costly and even harmful by creating a huge air call for future migratory waves.  The only effective migration policy is the re-establishment of national borders to allow states to freely decide on their migration policy, as well as the systematic removal of illegal migrants and the creation of refugee centres in countries bordering war zones.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. I voted against this report because it aims to redeploy EUR 100 million to manage migrants, and to strengthen Europol, which advocates the European NRL and the total dismantling of internal borders.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: In writing. The report aims to establish a budgetary structure for the emergency aid instrument in the context of the migration crisis, so that Member States can take in migrants. The instrument will be endowed with EUR 100 million and managed by the European Commission's Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection Service (ECHO).  In addition, it intends to strengthen the staff of Europol's European Counter-Terrorism Centre to provide operational and analytical assistance to Member States.  However, this financial instrument will create a huge air appeal for migrants. Moreover, Europol is an ineffective body, which has done little to help in the fight against terrorism, as it is unable to estimate the real threat caused by the presence of terrorists in the ranks of migrants.  I am strongly against this text.

name: Sander LOONES
text: Written. 'Approval of this amended budget was needed to strengthen Europol's counter-terrorism cell (ECTC).' The N-VA has always been in favour of the start-up of this cell in order to make the most of Europol's expertise in the fight against terrorism and to enable better cooperation between EU Member States. The cell was started in January 2016 and budgeting follows. At the same time, the amending budget aims to allocate a first tranche to the new EU humanitarian instrument, which will pay out €700 million to NGOs in Greece. The N-VA has already indicated that it considers it appropriate for the private sector to take over the reception of the public sector there, now that this southern European country is manifestly failing to fulfil that obligation under the Common European Asylum System (GEAS). Moreover, this report aimed to shift the budget without increasing the total resources. This budget-neutral amendment, which benefits the safety of European citizens and the needs of asylum seekers, fully supports the N-VA Delegation.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. Although we share the need to adequately fund the different actors who are helping migrants and refugees in the European Union, this proposal comes back from a counterparty to strengthen Europe's Stronghold model. Under no circumstances can we share an increase in Europol's budget, particularly in the context of migration policy, as it would support closed detention centres and collective expulsions which are now the norm. That is why, and taking into account the urgency of the former, we have decided to abstain in this vote.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. Considering the mass arrival of refugees and migrants in Europe, an exceptional situation has been created in which large numbers of people need humanitarian assistance on European territory.  This situation has pushed Member States, especially the most affected countries, to the limit of their responsiveness. At Union level, there was no adequate instrument to provide the necessary assistance, in extreme cases such as where we find ourselves, when people in the EU are affected by a catastrophe.  For this reason, I support the EC's initiative to create a budgetary structure, which makes available the funds needed to address the humanitarian consequences of the current crisis.  Thanks to this project we will be able to accommodate and assist refugees arriving on the territory of the Union. From the above, I vote in favour of the approval of the same.

name: Bernd LUCKE
text: Writing. The first amending budget of the current year is taking the right steps: the introduction of a new budget line for the provision of emergency aid within the Union will ensure budgetary authenticity. The figure provides planning certainty for the years 2016 to 2018 and allows emergency aid to be rapidly delivered from the Union budget in the territory of the Union to deal with the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. This solution is a good simplification of procedures. I welcome the fact that funds are to be made available for this purpose through a redeployment in the budget. I would like to see the same for the funds in 2017/2018. The staff of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre, which is based at Europol, will also be increased. This is in line with our call for more resources to increase security in Europe. That is why I voted in favour of the Fernandes report.

name: Petr MACH
text: Writing. \u2012 I've been here. The proposal proposes to increase the number of europol counter-terrorism staff and approves the allocation of EUR 300 million for humanitarian aid in the context of the migration crisis. I believe that it is appropriate to help, for example, Greece to finance refugee camps at the expense of other EU spending. However, I am sceptical about the EU's ability to address the humanitarian problems associated with migration and the solution primarily lies with the Member States, and the fact is that the Member States and their citizens, including the Czech Republic, are voluntarily assisting the states in the south-east of Europe with border control and dealing with the humanitarian crisis.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 In view of what has happened over the last couple of years, especially last year, I fully support the installation of this new financial instrument, which will at least partially be able to provide support from member states affected by the migrant/refugee crisis, first of all to Greece and Italy. I also unequivocally support the increase in funding for the European Counter-Terrorism Centre and Europol so that they can combat more effectively the logical risks that such a large influx of people is irresistibly brought with them. It is understood that in the case of each individual country, the current crisis will also be addressed through other sources, but the funding available in 2016, EUR 200 million in 2017 and EUR 200 million in 2018 is likely to be insufficient. I therefore very much hope that the Commission and the Council already have, or are planning, alternative sources of funding and/or additional resources for overcoming the crisis.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: Writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the report on the Council's position on draft amending budget No 1/2012. 1/2016 of the European Union for the financial year 2016: A new instrument for providing emergency support within the Union, because it is well documented.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted against this text.  This draft report proposes yet another supplementary budget envelope for migrants. It has two components: - the creation of an emergency fund that can be quickly unblocked by Member States facing the migrant crisis. This fund would be created by redeploying EUR 80.2 billion in payment credits. The management of this fund would be the responsibility of the European Commission's humanitarian aid and civil protection department; - strengthening Europol's counter-terrorism service by providing two million euros in payment credits.  The National Front strongly opposes any additional financial envelope for migration policies, if not for the return of migrants to their countries of origin. In addition, any additional device would be likely to create an air call for other immigration applicants.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Favourable to draft adjusted budget n1/2016: new instrument for the provision of emergency support within the Union. The Commission's proposal to allow the EU budget to provide sound emergency aid on EU territory due to the consequences of the current refugee crisis

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. We welcome the proposal to allow the EU budget to provide emergency assistance on EU territory to deal with the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis.  However, it is to be desired that stable mechanisms are created to deal with such situations. A more sustainable legal and budgetary framework should be envisaged to enable the future mobilisation of humanitarian aid within the Union. My support also supports the increase in resources to strengthen the European Counter-Terrorism Centre set up by Interpol.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. This report proposes to endorse the EU's first amending budget for 2016. This correction takes place as early as April, whereas it did not take place until July in 2015. As a result, Europe's fiscal unpresercated budget is increasing as austerity worsens.  We are talking about finding extensions to deal with the migrant crisis, which was already proven to be urgent in the budget vote last November. These extensions are just tinkering: to finance the payment of outstanding shares, the Commission proposes to freeze commitment appropriations, which will therefore be lacking to launch other actions planned elsewhere.  The argument that is supposed to justify these budgetary manipulations confuses the need to deal with the migrant crisis and to fight terrorism in Europe in order to grant new means to Europol. We also learn, by the way, that the financial mechanisms of the EU-Turkey agreement on migrants lack a legal basis in the European budget. This shows that the billions promised to Turkey do not exist: if they are ever paid, it will only be at the cost of new amending budgets making cuts in other sectors.  I am voting against this ever more disastrous fiscal policy from year to year.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. The intended instrument has inefficient and expensive elements. Moreover, this scheme, far from deterring mass immigration, will accentuate it by the unconditional protection it offers. I do not trust an organization like Europol to provide a relevant response to terrorism. I believe that states are best able to respond to the crises that our Europe is experiencing.  As a result, I voted against it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. The massive influx of refugees and migrants to Europe has created an exceptional situation in which a large number of people need emergency humanitarian aid in the Union, and this emergency situation exceeds the response capacity of the most affected Member States. There is no adequate instrument at Union level to respond to the humanitarian needs of those affected in the Union. This Commission proposal aims to enable the Union budget to provide emergency support within the Union in order to cope with the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis. At the moment, we are witnessing a deterioration in the situation of migrants and asylum seekers, in particular because the response of European countries is not coordinated, which makes this emergency support all the more necessary and urgent. We must show solidarity with the Member States facing this emergency situation on their territory. Hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ Following the submission of the Commission and taking into account the Council’s position, I chose to support this report, which highlights the various measures agreed by the Commission, Council and Parliament to balance the additional funds required from Member States.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. I fully support the European Commission's proposal to set up an instrument to provide emergency aid within the Union's borders.  Above all, it is a matter of enabling it to respond quickly and adequately to major crises and, therefore, to help Member States cope with the influx of large numbers of refugees. I welcome the spirit of solidarity between the Member States that presided over the implementation of this measure. I draw attention to the fact that this aid will not in any way undermine external emergency humanitarian aid, that is to say vis-à-vis third countries.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ In light of the current deteriorating situation of migrants and asylum seekers, particularly due to the uncoordinated response by European countries, which makes such emergency support all the more necessary and urgent and the need to show solidarity with the Member States facing such an emergency situation on their territory, I welcome the commission proposal and voted in favour of the draft Amending Budget No 1/ 2016: New instrument to provide emergency support within the Union.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 On 2 March 2016, the Commission presented a proposal for a Council Regulation aimed at creating the missing means of managing humanitarian needs within the Union. On 15 March 2016, the Council adopted Regulation (EU) 2016/369 and submitted draft araks 1/2016, which provide for a commitment appropriation of EUR 100 million and a payment appropriation of EUR 80.2 million for immediate financing needs under Regulation 2016/369. However, the Commission estimates that the financing needs will be EUR 300 million in 2016 and EUR 200-200 million in 2017 and 2018, and that additional needs are expected to arise if the influx of migrants and refugees continues at the current rate.  In its report, the Committee on Budgets recommends that Parliament welcome the Commission's proposal to provide emergency assistance from the EU budget to deal with the humanitarian consequences of the current refugee crisis within the Union, approve the Council's draft arak no. 1/2016 and confirm that, given the urgency of the situation, it is ready to adopt it in the form submitted by the Commission. I voted in favour of the proposal of the Committee on Budgets.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. This report includes two main elements: the creation of an emergency aid budgetary structure to provide faster assistance to Member States facing migrant crises, and the strengthening of Europol's European Counter-Terrorism Centre staff. These instruments will be costly and ineffective, as well as creating a huge air appeal for migrants. The only solution to the migrant crisis is to restore national borders to leave states free to decide on their migration policy. As for Europol, this body underestimated the fact that terrorists could use migration flows to infiltrate terrorists on European territory. It is therefore surprising to want to give him more responsibility in the fight against terrorism. We are voting against this draft amending budget.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. The Fernandez report includes two main elements: the creation of a budgetary structure for the emergency aid instrument to provide faster aid to EU countries facing migrant crises through the redeployment of 100 million euros. However, the needs of this instrument are estimated by the ratio to 300 million euros in 2016. Secondly, the reinforcement of the staff of Europol's European counter-terrorism centre to the tune of 2 million euros. Needless to say, these instruments will prove to be completely ineffective, costly and even harmful by creating a huge air call for future migrants. The only effective migration policy is the re-establishment of national borders to allow states to freely decide on their migration policy, as well as the systematic return of migrants and the creation of refugee centres in countries bordering war zones. As for the fight against terrorism, it cannot be entrusted to a body (Europol) which has underestimated the fact that the Islamic State could use migratory flows to infiltrate terrorists and which promotes the total dismantling of national borders. I voted against it.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this budget report, which proposes to give the European Union additional resources to manage the migration crisis and strengthen our fight against terrorism.  In particular, the text endorses the proposal to increase the staffing of the European Counter-Terrorism Centre within Europol and calls on the Commission to exclude all agencies concerned by migration and security from the target of a 5% reduction in staff.

name: Renaud MUSELIER
text: In writing. In order to support the EU countries most affected by the current migration situation in the European Union, we have decided to set up an amending budget by reallocating part of the multi-year financial framework.  The draft thus adopted is based on two main areas: emergency aid and the provision of funds on the one hand, and the strengthening of the european counter-terrorism centre within the Europol agency on the other.  In view of our priorities for regulating migration flows and strengthening controls and security on European territory, this resolution allows for the implementation of a measure which I consider not only useful but above all necessary.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 This is a difficult time for the European Union. By fulfilling our basic human duties, we are trying to provide emergency humanitarian assistance and at the same time combat security challenges.
